company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.
job_description:
JOB DETAILS﻿
The Institute of High-Performance Computing (IHPC) of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) Singapore is seeking an exceptional Computer Vision/Machine Learning Scientist to expand our dynamic and multi-disciplinary AI team.
We are looking for an excellent research scientist with a background in Computer Vision and Machine learning to work on human action understanding using neurosymbolic AI approaches. Background in scene graph generation, human object interaction, action recognition, relational learning, inductive logic programming, and causal learning is highly advantageous.
Job requirements:
  • PhD degree in Computer Vision or Machine Learning (or related discipline)
  • Record in CVPR, ECCV, ICCV, NIPS, ICML, WACV, ICLR, AAAI, IJCAI or journal papers in IEEE TPAMI, IJCV, Pattern Recognition, IEEE TIP and related are preferred
  • Strong programming skills in python (Pytorch, Tensorflow)
  • Excellent computer vision and machine learning skills are required.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_title: Senior Assistant Manager, Population Health Analytics
company_overview:
The National University Polyclinics (NUP) is a member of the National University Health System (NUHS), a leading academic health system and one of three public healthcare clusters in Singapore.

NUP provides primary care treatment for acute illnesses, management of chronic diseases, women and children health services, and dental care at its network of polyclinics at Bukit Batok, Bukit Panjang, Choa Chu Kang, Clementi, Jurong, Pioneer, Queenstown (with Tengah and Yew Tee to come).

As part of an integrated academic health system, NUP collaborates with the hospitals and national specialty centres within NUHS as well as partner general practitioners, grassroots, the community and social care partners to provide patient-centred care for the population.

For more information, please visit www.nup.com.sg | www.nuhs.edu.sg

Delivering ‘Incredible care and health, together!’

Members of the NUHS:
·         National University Hospital
·         Ng Teng Fong General Hospital
·         Alexandra Hospital
·         Jurong Community Hospital
·         National University Polyclinics
·         National University Cancer Centre, Singapore
·         National University Heart Centre, Singapore
·         National University Centre for Oral Health, Singapore

job_description:
Reporting to the Assistant Director, you will work in a team to develop and leverage on variety of analytics methods, tools, visualization, and modelling techniques to provide insights and applied analytics for decision making and solving business problem and challenges in population health.
Job Responsibilities
You will be responsible for the following:
  • Leveraging knowledge and skill with a variety of analytic tools to design, create, maintain powerful visualizations and models that illuminate opportunities to support strategic planning and initiatives, improve organizational performance, project future demand, and advance progress towards population health outcome and impact
  • Contribute to the design of end-to-end strategy, approach and methodology for population health data insights, analytics, and evaluation
  • Build routine reports and operational monitoring dashboards for essential population health metrics
  • Engage and work with the relevant stakeholders in NUP, NUHS cluster level and ministry level to gather data and provide data to gain both micro and macro insights to aid in strategic planning
  • Identify new dataset which are essential in supporting population health program monitoring and evaluation and incorporate as part of the data management strategy and roadmap
  • Perform data analysis and trending observations for possible areas for attention when required
  • Ensure timely generation of regular reports based on established reporting requirements.
  • Any other responsibilities as assigned by your supervisor
Requirements
  • Degree from an established university in a related field such as statistics, data science, business analytics, analytics, applied mathematics. Master’s degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Management or Public Health will be an added advantage.
  • At least 3 years of relevant experience in planning and data analytics environment.
  • Proficient in working with data in SQL and Excel and creating dashboard using Tableau.
  • Experience and knowledge of statistical modeling technique.
  • Proficient in 1 or more of the software such as R, OBIEE, Python, H2O Flow, Flexsim etc.
  • Proficient in use of Microsoft Office Applications for word processing and presentation.
  • Adaptive and pick up new skillsets fast as per organization needs.
  • A team player with excellent written and verbal communication and collaboration skills.
  • Resourceful and analytical, with ability to synergies data concisely for decision support.
  • Good in strategic planning.

job_description:
As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be in-charged of mobile analysis and apply Machine learning model. You will also be doing data mining on day to day basis.

Client Details

Once of the big tech company in video game industry. They recently made a big acquisition, thus they are expanding their data team to capture Asia market.

Description

As a Qualified Senior Data Analyst, you are responsible:

  • Provide insights to understand the impact of product decisions
  • Working with the development teams to help determine what data needs to be captured
  • Analyzing gameplay and economy telemetry data to understand the impact of overall player experience, before and after the product launches
  • Analyzing game and player data to understand the player behaviour and enhance the quality of the player experience
  • Regularly performing ad hoc analyses for development, live ops, and performance marketing teams
  • Presenting findings taken from data analysis both in person and in presentation form for remote groups
  • Designing, testing and implementing scalable and repeatable model framework for user acquisition, engagement and monetization strategies around liveops
  • Defining and establishing business KPIs as well as creating and distributing regular performance reports and dashboards

Profile

As a Qualified Candidates, you shall possess:

  • B.A. or B.S. in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering Sciences (or in another quantitative discipline)
  • At least 5 years of experience in data mining & analytics with very large, complex and multi-dimensional data sets
  • Experience with predictive modelling techniques and accomplished in use of one of the statistical software packages like R, or Python
  • Knowledge of one or more of the following: time series, experimental design, classification, clustering, and regression analysis
  • Expert in relational databases, and proficient with SQL
  • Advanced experience with Tableau or other similar visualization tools

Nice to have:

  • Experience with machine learning and deep learning
  • Experience with big data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, or Hive
  • Knowledge of free-to-play mobile game economics and/or performance marketing

Job Offer

  • Flexible WFH arrangement

job_title: Research Associate (Computer Science and Data Science) - R00005334
company_overview:
About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore
A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.
NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).
Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.
Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.
For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg

company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. job_description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
(Research Scientist in Knowledge engineering; Knowledge extraction; Knowledge graphs; Graph Reasoning; Artificial Intelligence)
Social and Cognitive Computing department at the Institute of High Performance Computing, A*STAR, Singapore invites applicants with passion to conduct RD in knowledge engineering with experience in knowledge extraction, representation, and modeling; knowledge graphs and reasoning techniques. You will be part of our team developing decision support and question answering systems based on automatically constructed knowledge bases from multiple sources.
A successful candidate will be involved in some or all of the following tasks:
  • Perform research in knowledge extraction and modeling / knowledge graphs / knowledge-based reasoning systems.
  • Evaluate developed systems with use cases motivated by industry.
  • Actively collaborate with other researchers in RD activities including scientific publication and grant proposal writing, system development, testing and deployment of intelligent systems.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
  • PhD in computer science, information systems, or a related field
  • A good scientific track record and practical experience in some of the following fields: natural langu processing, knowledge engineering, knowledge bases and reasoning systems, computational and artificial intelligence, cognitive systems
  • Being a team player with good communication skills
  • Strong skills in scripting langus (e.g. Python)
  • Experience in graph learning and langu models
  • Experience in graph databases like Neo4j, TigerGraph, etc.
  • Strong skills in functional programming and langus like LISP or Clojure
  • Experience in designing and performing a grant project
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_title: Senior Assistant Manager, Quality, Innovation & Improvement (Analytics)
company_overview:
The Ng Teng Fong General Hospital (NTFGH) and Jurong Community Hospital (JCH) are members of the National University Health System (NUHS), a leading academic health system and one of three public healthcare clusters in Singapore.
Known as the JurongHealth Campus, NTFGH and JCH are Singapore’s first integrated healthcare development designed and built together from the ground up. Designed around the patients’ needs, the twin development enables NTFGH patients who no longer require acute care to be easily transferred to rehabilitate and recuperate in JCH. Both hospitals are also managed by one healthcare team to facilitate integration at all levels to enable better patient care, greater efficiency and convenience. NTFGH is also the first in Singapore and ASEAN to attain HIMSS EMRAM Stage 7, with JCH at HiMSS EMRAM Stage 6 – an achievement which recognises hospitals with the highest level of adoption and utilisation of electronic medical record functions. 
As part of an integrated academic health system, NTFGH and JCH, in collaboration with partners in the healthcare continuum, aims to transform healthcare to deliver holistic and seamless patient-centred care.
For more information, please visit www.ntfgh.com.sg | www.jch.com.sg | www.nuhs.edu.sg
Delivering ‘Incredible care and health, together!’
Members of the NUHS:
• National University Hospital
• Ng Teng Fong General Hospital
• Alexandra Hospital
• Jurong Community Hospital
• National University Polyclinics
• National University Cancer Centre, Singapore
• National University Heart Centre, Singapore
• National University Centre for Oral Health, Singapore
• NUS Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine
• NUS Faculty of Dentistry
• NUS Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health
job_description:
Seeking an individual with a passion for using data to perform data analysis to provide better support in performance management and decision making to drive improvements in patient care and other organisational goals. The position is expected to work closely with clinicians, administrators and healthcare professionals to primarily address both user needs and technical aspects of working with data.
The incumbent shall:
  • Apply statistical methods in quantitative analysis, data mining, predictive modelling, as well as the visualisation and presentation of data to derive insights that value-add to management decision making (e.g. hypothesis testing, validation of business cases, development of data products such as predictive models or Tableau dashboards etc)
  • Support Director, Assistant Director and senior colleagues to organise information and analytics use cases to support data and analytics related activities for the organisation
  • Provide guidance for the use of analytics methods to support decision-making
  • Support Director, Assistant Director and senior colleagues to work with frontline and backend staff to develop or streamline work processes for ease of access to organisation resources for data request, extraction, analysis and reporting to support operational needs
  • Support Director, Assistant Director and senior colleagues to work on projects with users from various teams to deliver advanced analytics solutions to solve business problems
The Requirements
  • Good Postgraduates/Bachelor Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business Analytics, or other relevant fields
  • Strong technical background and expertise in the areas of statistical analysis and modelling, data management and data visualisation (Proficiency in analytics softwares like R and data visualisation tools such as Tableau would be ideal)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, able to work with diverse group of stakeholders
  • Self-motivated, ability to multitask and prioritize projects to meet deadlines
  • At least 4 years relevant experience for Assistant Manager - Healthcare experience would be a bonus

job_title: Scientist [Federated Learning, Blockchain] - Computing & Intelligence - IHPC
company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.
job_description:
﻿
The Institute of High Performance Computing (IHPC) was established in April 1998 to provide leadership in high performance computing as a strategic resource for scientific inquiry and industry development. Our mission is to advance science and technology, and develop leading-edge applications through high performance computing and computational science. We have long-term ties with industry partners, including multinational companies and local SMEs, which ensures that our R&D activities stay focused and relevant to real-world needs. We also have active cooperation with the world’s top academics and academic institutions.We are looking for highly motivated individuals who are able to work independently and yet are good team players, possess excellent analytical, technical and problem-solving skills, good technical writing and presentation skills. If you share our interests in solving challenging scientific problems, we welcome you to apply for the following positions.Research Scientists & Engineers (Federated Learning, Blockchain)We seek motivated scientists and engineers with talents and inclination to pursue cutting-edge research in Federated Learning and Blockchain, and are keen to join a team developing the trusted computing technology.You will conduct cutting-edge R&D on Federated Learning and Blockchain related projects/grants. These positions involve developing various trusted digital applications, systems and platforms such as for healthcare, digital economy, suply chain, agritech, advanced manufacturing and engineering, as well as the Smart Nation initiative.Requirement
  • * PhD/Master/Bachelor degree in Computer Science/Electrical & Electronics Engineering/Computer Engineering or equivalent.
  • * Solid programming skills in Python, C/C++, Java, Javascript, GO, Node.JS and/or CUDA programming.
  • * Experience in one or more areas of trusted computing, such as Federated Learning, Blockchain, Distributed Machine Learning, Differential Privacy, Multi-party Computing, Machine Learning, Parallel and Distributed Computing, etc.
Preferred qualifications (one or more of the following)
  • * Experience in applying Federated Learning or Blockchain to real-world problems.
  • * Relevant work experience in industry and/or academia.
  • * Expertise in one or more areas/topics of Federated Learning, such as Model Aggregation for Non-IID, Communication-efficient FL, Robust FL, Privacy-privacy FL using Differential Privacy and Multi-party Computing, Secure FL, Horizontal FL/Vertical FL, Personalized FL, FL with Central Server, Decentralized FL, etc.
  • * Expertise in one or more areas/topics of Blockchain, such as Hyperledger Fabric, Tendermint, Ethereum, Bitcoin, Distributed Ledger, Smart Contract, Consensus Protocol, Virtual Machine, Container, etc.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree, Doctorate (PhD)

job_title: Scientist I or II (Quantum Technologies for Engineering), IMRE
company_overview:
About Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
A*STAR is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
About the Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE)
The Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE) is a research institute under A*STAR’s Science and Engineering Research Council, with a unique combination of R&D capabilities, commercial partnerships and strategic alliances. We have global-leading capabilities in developing advanced materials that lead to new commercial products. IMRE’s deep partnerships with international organisations, research institutes and industry partners have allowed us to build strong research capabilities and catalyse materials-enabled solutions to meet global challenges in sustainability, health, communications and economic growth.
job_description:
The Quantum Imaging and Sensing Group in the Institute of Materials Research and Engineering is looking for a research scientist for a project in the field of quantum and nonlinear optics. The project is related to quantum interferometry of correlated photon pairs and its application in broadband infrared micro-spectroscopy of a specimen. (D. Kalashnikov et al, Nature Photonics 10, 98 (2016); A. Paterova et al, Science Advances 6(44), eabd0460 (2020)).

The successful candidate will carry out the following work:

  • Develop new schemes of quantum interferometry for high resolution infrared micro-spectroscopy;
  • Perform experimental realisation of the schemes in the optics laboratory;
  • Study new type of nonlinear crystals to improve the performance of quantum interferometry technique;
  • Perform simple automation of the experimental setup by software programming of scientific instruments, such as translation stages, sensors et al;
  • Interpret and analyse obtained experimental results;
  • Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of researchers.

1. PhD degree on quantum/nonlinear physics or in related fields;

2. Experimental work experience in quantum/nonlinear optics laboratory;

3. Experience in software programming (Labview and/or Python) would be a plus;

4. Proficient with Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint;

5. Ability to communicate effectively and clearly with the team.
job_requirement_qualification: Doctorate (PhD)

job_title: Specialist, Data Management, Industrial Asia Pacific
company_overview:
Schaeffler Group – We pioneer motion

As a leading global supplier to the automotive and industrial sectors, the Schaeffler Group has been driving forward groundbreaking inventions and developments in the fields of motion and mobility for over 75 years.

With innovative technologies, products, and services for electric mobility, CO2-efficient drives, Industry 4.0, digitalization, and renewable energies, the company is a reliable partner for making motion and mobility more efficient, intelligent, and sustainable. The technology company manufactures high-precision components and systems for powertrain and chassis applications as well as rolling and plain bearing solutions for a large number of industrial applications.
job_description:
The role will be responsible for the operative material data creation and maintenance for Demand Management in Industrial Asia Pacific to secure the operative business for Trading Plants including Regional Levelling Points, Distribution Centers and Satellite Distribution Centers. He/she will be responsible for relevant data quality indicators and process KPIs based on global rules in Industrial Asia Pacific.

Key Responsibilities

Operative Material Data Management 

  • Release and processing of RfMM (Request for Material Master) workflows in SAP_EP1
  • Manual creation of material data in SAP_P66
  • Material Purchasing Data creation, including Purchase Info Record (PIR), PREF, Quality Info Record (QIR) and Vendor List
  • Definition and maintanence of Field Entry Documentation (FED) rules
  • Maintenance of data and improvement of the material data quality

  • Requesting master data changes and tracking outside of the Industrial Asia Pacific network
  • Execution of product replacements and relocations within the system to ensure fulfilment of the global product management strategy

Schaeffler Quality Initiatives & KPIs

  • Responsible for the monitoring and achievement of relevant process KPIs/Data Quality Indicators for material data including RfMM, DQ-MMR PlanMats (Data Quality of relevant Material Master Record fields for Demand Planning materials), Material Status Release and MDSC/DQ-DC & DQC etc., for Industrial Asia Pacific Trading Plants and to define improvement activities in case of any deviations

Project Management

  • Implementation of projects in the context of continuous improvement process and quality management
  • Support and particiapte in (sub-)projects with focus on Demand Management Material Data
  • Alignment with process owner regarding extensive process changes or requirements 

Pre-requisites

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Engineering, Information Systems, Business Administration (specialization on Supply Chain Management) or relevant field
  • Minimum of 1-3 years professional experience in the related field of Material Data Management
  • Proficient in SAP-R/3 (MM, PP, SD Modules) and Microsoft office applications
  • Detailed oriented to ensure data accuracy within SAP system based on defined guidelines
  • Team player and able to communicate effectively

Note:

We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

job_title: Senior/Scientist [Empathetic Systems], Social & Cognitive Computing, IHPC
company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.
job_description:
The Affective and Social Intelligence Group focuses on developing and applying new intelligent systems that are capable of recognizing emotions from multi-modal visual and non-visual (voice, language) cues. To attain to a new height of our research impact, we seek to pursue advanced research building next-generation machine intelligence incorporating socio-technical considerations including but not limited to empathy, value, goal and strategy. Our research is highly interdisciplinary, and we seek to establish leadership in the intersection area of Empathy AI, Affective Computing and Computational Social Science.
The candidate will assume the responsibility as a lead researcher who shall contribute to the architecture and systems development, and lead in research activities including critical literature review, theoretical analyses, appropriation and evaluation of these systems in potential applications. The candidate will also have opportunities to work closely with the lead investigators, research scientists and engineers, collaborators and experts from the industry partners, to engage in both the basic research as well as translational research activities that bring the research outcomes into real-world impact.
JOB REQUIREMENT
  • A PhD degree in Computer Science / Information Technology / Computer Engineering / Information Systems / Computational Social Science or equivalent
  • A compelling scientific publications track record and demonstrable independent research capabilities
  • Hands-on experience in using machine learning, deep learning frameworks and models
  • Proficient with programming languages (e.g., Python, C/C++, Matlab)
  • Cross-disciplinary research experiences are especially valued
  • Candidates with no relevant working experience are welcomed to apply
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
job_requirement_qualification: Doctorate (PhD)

company_overview:
About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore
A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.
NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).
Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.
Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.
For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg

company_overview: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.
job_description:
Overview
We are currently looking for a Clinical Applications Consultant with a strong background in Next Generation Sequencing and Bioinformatics. You would be part of a team focused on supporting the software/analysis needs of clinical testing labs from the Asia Pacific and Japan region.
Responsibilities
  • Understand and support the needs of customers implementing Lab Developed Tests on the software/analysis for our Thermo Fisher Scientific / Ion Torrent / Oncomine™ product portfolio.
  • “Customer first” approach to troubleshooting clinical support issues.
  • Responsible for maximizing customer value/satisfaction by aligning complex product solutions and services with key customer initiatives.
  • Build and maintain relationships with key decision makers and/or potential influencers
  • Understanding the clinical regulated LDT customer and work with Oncology Sales to develop a successful commercial strategy for this market.
  • Manage technical escalations from support teams in the Asia Pacific and Japan region.
Job duties will include the following tasks:
  • Review and assist customers with analyses of their Ion Torrent data using Torrent Suite, Ion Reporter, and Oncomine™ Reporter software packages.
  • Help customers design and conduct experiments to assist in evaluations of Ion Torrent / Thermo Fisher products.
  • Promote new clinical product solutions at customer sites and at conferences/user meetings.
  • Work in collaboration with the Oncology Sales Team and Thermo Fisher support partners to set up the best support strategy for each customer site
  • Build strong relationships with customers.
  • Maintain consistent and structured communication with counterparts and articulate summarized communication to Manager on a periodic basis.
  • Obtain successful adoption of the technology within all applied markets while investigating the potential of other applications and solutions both pre-clinically and clinically.
  • Align with other teams in the company on a regular basis.
  • Estimated 30% travel.
Experience/Qualifications/Qualities that are important in this role
  • Graduate (minimum) qualification in an appropriate science subject, molecular biology or bioinformatics preferred with 5 years of relevance experience
  • Knowledge of Linux and scripting required.
  • Experience in bioinformatics application is mandatory. Molecular biology experience is strongly desirable.
  • “Customer First” approach to support.
  • Previous experience as application specialist desirable (NGS experience desirable).
  • Excellent communication and influencing skills.
  • Ability to understand and articulate complex scientific literature and use extensive complex clinical data as a key factor in the sales process.
  • Strong drive for success
  • Medical background, laboratory experience, and/or managed care knowledge desirable skills.
  • Understanding regulatory guidelines is desired but not mandatory (CAP, CLIA, NYSDH, etc.).

job_description:

  • To design and develop deep learning-driven capabilities for intelligent edge computing services in 5G-and-beyond industrial Internet-of-Things networks.
  • To design and develop data-driven capabilities for industrial 5G and- beyond communications.
  • To design and develop theoretical performance analysis frameworks for 5G-and-beyond industrial Internet-of-Things networks.
  • To testbed and evaluate the feasibility of intelligent edge computing services and data-driven industrial 5G-and-beyond communications for industrial partners and stakeholders based on practical scenarios and requirements from industry.
  • Translate factory automation related emerging technology use case requirements into grant and project proposals.
  • To address industry needs by overseeing, leading, presenting and delivering intelligent edge computing services and data-driven industrial 5G-and-beyond solutions to member companies and stakeholders
  • Writing of technical reports and presentation of technical solutions and results for grant applications.

  • PhD in wireless communications and networks, computer science, electrical & electronic engineering, electrical & computer engineering, and related fields.
  • Good knowledge and experience of data analytics and machine learning/deep learning techniques to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Good knowledge and experience in communication protocol stacks and networks in general, and wireless communication networks.
  • Good knowledge and research experience in 5G communications, multi-access edge computing, and applied machine learning in wireless communications.
  • Good programming experience in Python, MATLAB, Mathematica.
  • Team player and strong interpersonal and communication (verbal & written) skills.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong track record in leading research publications.
  • Motivated self-starter with a strong enthusiasm to learn.

job_title: Associate Professor / Senior Lecturer / Lecturer (Business Analytics), School of Computing
company_overview: A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.
job_description:
Short Description

The NUS School of Computing (SOC) traces its roots back to the Nanyang University Department of Computer Science that was established in 1975.  Since then, SOC has developed into one of the leading computing schools in the world, with faculty members who are both internationally recognised researchers and inspiring teachers.

Today, SOC offers undergraduate and graduate degree programmes across the full spectrum of the field of computing, including Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering, Business Analytics and Information Security, as well as specialisations in emerging areas of importance such as artificial intelligence, fintech, blockchain, analytics and security.

SOC Advanced Computing for Executives (ACE) unit was established to help business leaders, managers and professionals learn about emerging technology and how to harness them for digital transformation and business competitiveness.  ACE drives the expansion of SOC's lifelong learning offerings in a concerted and strategic way and aims to be the premier educator and thought leader in advanced computing and information technology.
 

Long Description

To augment our manpower resources in the School, we are looking for a suitably qualified candidate to join ACE unit.  Reporting to the Head, Executive Education, the incumbent shall develop, review and deliver executive education programmes/seminars related to Data Science, Business Analytics and Applied Statistics to business leaders, managers and professionals, as well as provide support in outreach activities and consultancy work.

The incumbent will be emplaced at an appropriate appointment grade, based on the individual merits of the candidate.
This role is offered on a 3-year renewable contract basis; renewal is subject to satisfactory on-the-job performance of the incumbent, and demand for the assigned programmes. 
Remuneration is on a 12- month salary package plus variable performance bonus, as well as regular employee benefits such as leave, medical and insurance coverage.
 

Job Description
  • Initiate, design, conduct and administer programmes, workshops and seminars as assigned
  • Liaise with Programme Managers and clients in determining training needs such that course materials are designed and contextualised to achieve desired learning outcomesDevise training strategies and create training materials, including testing and reviewing created materials
  • Monitor and assess learners' work, invigilate examinations
  • Source for and harness resources for instructional technology
  • Provide credible training consultancy services for ACE's clients
  • Participate in business development, marketing and promotion activities of assigned programmes
  • Research and stay current on the state of the art in artificial intelligence, business analytics and other information communication technology (ICT) practices
  • Supervise and coach training assistants in supporting training sessions
  • Carry out administrative duties as required
     
Qualifications

Academic & Professional Certification

  • At least a Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Analytics, Statistics, or an IT-related discipline from a reputable university
  • In-depth knowledge of and experience in advanced business analytics and data visualisation 
  • Sound technical experience with applications like Microsoft Excel, Power BI, Tableau and QlikSense, as well as coding using R and Python, preferred
  • Exposure to data mining, machine learning, deep learning, big data, artificial intelligence, simulation and deployment of production data science models an advantage 

Experience & Attributes 

  • Minimum 5 years' relevant working experience including the teaching of adult learners, especially business leaders, managers and professionals, with at least 3 years in a similar capacity
  • Excellent presentation skills; ability to present and explain difficult concepts clearly, concisely and in plain simple English
  • Familiarity with the use of live streaming technologies, smart boards, etc. is a plus
  • IT savvy and proficient in information systems and business analytics
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Highly numerate, analytical and meticulous with strong administration skillsResults-driven, self-motivated and highly disciplined
  • Strong team player, able to work collaboratively with various stakeholders to achieve desired outcomes
  • Resilient, resourceful with good problem-solving and critical-thinking skills, and thrives in a fast-paced, results-oriented and ambiguous work environment
     
More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: School of Computing

Department : Department of Information Systems And Analytics

Employee Referral Eligible: Yes

Footer

To apply, please submit a comprehensive CV stating the expected monthly salary, together with a copy of all academic certificates before 30 Apr 2021.
Shortlisted candidates should be prepared to complete other administrative formalities before the interviews.

job_description:
WHAT YOU’LL DO

·      Provide expertise in design, development and implementation of Business Intelligence (BI) and analytics systems.

·      Design and model the data warehouse systems, and develop BI reporting and analysis applications.

·      Provide optimal and cost-effective solutions to business teams in achieving business objectives.

·      Provide functional and technical guidance to business teams when needed.

·      Conduct business meetings with customers to determine project requirements and milestones.

·      Participate in the full life cycle of development, from specification and design through implementation, testing, and support.

·      Develop knowledge on business intelligence skills and processes.

·      Develop best practices to achieve project objectives and deliverables.

·      Develop positive working relationship with customers and other department staffs.

·      Stay updated with ongoing business developments and latest market trends.

·      Create a repository of the BI research results and findings.

REQUIREMENT

Minimum 5 Years:

·      Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.

·      More than 5 years of progressively complex related experience in a data-related or business intelligence position.

·      Solid experience in Tableau and Power BI development best practices, performance optimization, system tuning and design, and support

·      Proven knowledge in Data Warehouse, Data Modelling and Data Visualization on Azure/AWS/Google Cloud Platform

·      High proficiency in SQL (ANSI) with the ability to write complex freehand SQL including sub-queries, nested queries, and other advanced SQL features.

·      Proven experience with development and scripting in Java, Object-Oriented Languages, Python or any of the major languages to build robust data pipelines and dynamic systems.

·      A passion for data, and an understanding of how to work with large data sets consisting of as well as willingness to learn new technologies and methodologies under minimum guidance.

·      Excellent written and verbal communication, motivational, and interpersonal skills.

·      Excellent technical, diagnostic, and troubleshooting skills.

·      Creative thinking backed by strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

·      Strong teamwork, co-ordination, and planning, self-driven, and ability to work at pace in a dynamic organization.

job_description:
Job Responsibilities

Lead the Data Architecture activities spearheaded by Enterprise Architecture Team

  • Design and develop the architecture roadmap for big data platforms including data modelling, data security, master data management, etc..
  • Architect the data platform for the organization leveraging cloud native services and capabilities following best practices from industry and guidance/standards from LVMH group.
  • Design data models and associated metadata for mission critical and high-volume data systems, real-time and distributed data processing systems, data lakes/data warehouse
  • Work with systems and project teams in the overall IT solution, with the responsibility to ensure successful data design and implementation
  • Leading the teams to conceptualize, build and maintain the Data Infrastructure for relational as well as Big
  • Data Infrastructure to deliver a high-performance Data Environment to process Retail, Digital, Supply Chain, and Customer Data from various partners.
  • Being responsible for Data Warehousing Design, Data Integration Processes, Database Resource Planning, Infrastructure Performance, Data Governance and Security Management as well as design, architecture, implementation, and documentation of new, scalable ETL processes, pipelines, pathways and dimension aldata models.
  • Work with Data Scientist, Business Consultant and Frontend Developer to build scalable Data Analytics Apps using advanced analytics.
  • Audit and QA data and processes to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the data ecosystem
  • Design technology stack that can support Data Governance people and processes
  • Supervise Data Governance technical team removing roadblocks and mentoring the team to accelerate knowledge and Data Governance maturity.
  • Participate and lead data requirement gathering sessions with subject matter experts, data analyst/scientists, user communities, and other IT stakeholders
  • Responsible for data profiling, data analysis, data specification, data flows mapping, business logic documentation associated with new or modified data capture requirements
  • Navigate challenges in terms of uncertainty and focus on delivering high value at any given time
  • Communicate risks and issues to different stakeholders including senior/executive management

Qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent (MS preferred)
  • Work Experience Min. 8+ years of experience in data platform architecture

Critical knowledge & skills including tools, software applications, language, etc.

  • You have 10-15 years hands-on experience and a passion for data architecture in a big data environment, data warehousing, ETL Processes and related services as well as experience and a very good understanding of supporting technologies.
  • 3-5 years experiences architecting big data solutions on Alicloud/GCP leveraging cloud native services (i.e., PaaS). ·
  • Fluency in English language, Mandarin as added advantage
  • You should have a minimum of 3-5 years of designing and implementing Data Governance tools from a business perspective
  • Minimum 3 years working with visualization tools, data ingestion tools, API knowledge and has successfully executed application integrations
  • Ideal candidate will understand how people, process and technology can come together to enable advanced analytics, Data Science and data management
  • Experience in data quality, data governance, and supporting tools
  • Proven experience of cross functional leadership in complex organizations with strong emphasis on influencing and collaboration
  • Strong analytical orientation
  • Teach, mentor, and provide value on a consistent basis to stakeholders
  • Ability to translate strategy into an operational plan and can execute delivering consistent value to the organization·
  • You are a highly motivated, challenge-taking Personality with a positive attitude.
  • You feel comfortable in developing on your own but also in working with a team of developers
  • You like to work in a dynamic environment and collaborate with teams to build exciting new Data Products ·
  • You have very good experience in Database Technologies, like SQL and Big Data Technologies and Database Performance Tuning
  • Knowledge on Chinese Market and Chinese Language

company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

job_description:
Job Description
We are looking for candidates with the talent and passion to pursue first class research in Machine Learning (ML) and automated ML. You will be expected to conduct research, design and develop cutting edge models and algorithms for automating the machine learning process (e.g. automated data pre-processing, feature engineering, algorithm selection and hyperparameter tuning). You will also be expected to work closely with the researchers from IHPC to develop in-house capability in these areas. The successful candidates will have the opportunities to collaborate closely with researchers and practitioners from other A*STAR institutes, as well as industry partners to translate the developed solutions for tackling real world modelling and data analytics problems confronted today and in near future.
Requirements
  • Strong interest and capability in machine learning and automated machine learning.
  • Experience in analysing data using machine learning would be an advantage.
  • Excellent programming experience in Python.
  • Experience in other programming languages like Javascript, Java, R, C++ and Scala is a plus.
  • Smart and hardworking individual who can work under pressure within a tight deadline
  • A good team player with can-do attitude
  • Solid communication skills and problem-solving skills
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_title: Post Doctoral Fellow | Lab of Systems Biology & Data Analytics [GIS] #WorkNow
company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.
job_description:
The Genome Institute of Singapore (GIS) is an institute of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR). It has a global vision that seeks to use genomic sciences to achieve extraordinary improvements in human health and public prosperity. GIS is dedicated to creating a social culture that is focused on excellence, knowledge sharing, individual initiative and coordinated action. We have focused on recruiting and rewarding excellent people and establishing systems that will sustain this culture of excellence. Our scientists come from all five continents, from industrial and academic positions and from diverse disciplines. This diversity is unified in the pursuit of science for public health and prosperity.
Postdoctoral fellows: Machine Learning and Mathematical Analysis of Spatial Transcriptomics Data (Genome Institute of Singapore)
The Single-Cell In Situ Spatial Omics at subcellular Resolution (SCISSOR) team is looking for smart, motivated machine learning and data analytics researchers who can lead or contribute to the development of new imaging-based methods for understanding and diagnosing cancer.  The candidate should have strong mathematical intuition and programming skills, and be comfortable working in a highly collaborative multidisciplinary environment that includes biologists, imaging technologists, pathologists and medical oncologists. This will be a unique opportunity to work on new data types and ask new questions in the rapidly growing field of spatial Omics.
SCISSOR is a well-supported multidisciplinary program that creates spatial and non-spatial genomic technologies, applies them to clinical samples, generates massive multimodal datasets and interprets them to infer the molecular drivers of tumor growth and response to immunotherapy and other treatments. We have a track record of combining cutting-edge computational and experimental approaches to infer disease mechanisms and develop clinical applications (Chen et al., Science 2015; Li et al., Nat Genet 2017; Sun et al., Cell 2016; Fukawa et al., Nat Med 2016; del Rosario et al., Nat Methods 2015; Kumar et al., Nat Biotechnol 2013; Ku et al., Lancet Oncol 2012).
Requirements
  • PhD in mathematics, computer science, statistics, engineering, machine learning, signal processing, computer vision, computational genomics, or a related field
  • Experience with analysis and interpretation of genomic data
    • Strong programming skills
    • Quantitative intuition, and some mathematical maturity
    • Strong publication record
    • Strong communication skills
    • The ability to work closely with clinicians and experimental biologists
To apply, please email your CV and names of references to prabhakars@gis.a-star.edu.sg, arulrayan@gis.a-star.edu.sg
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree, Doctorate (PhD)

job_description:
The officer will be responsible for supporting the Digital Transformation, Innovation and Data Division (DTID) in building the A*STAR analytics ecosystem and improve the data processes and data quality within our core systems.
The officer will work with stakeholders from business units throughout A*STAR, the corporate services teams, and our technical partners and relevant third parties to deliver and implement an analytics ecosystem with trusted data to drive business insights and good clean data to run analytics models. The officer will be responsible for ensuring the implementation of data governance and quality requirements effectively and efficiently.
The officer will support the business users in deriving insights from the data and enabling data-driven decision making though implementation of business intelligence and data analytics.
The key objectives are to deliver business values by enabling a digitally savvy workforce, capable of delivering efficient and quality end-to-end services, with the ability to harness digital technology to make data-driven insights and decisions.
Job Responsibilities
  • Help process owners and business users discover the right dataset through using, for example, data catalogue and lineage, and building the framework for data search and retrieval
  • Assist the Digital Transformation, Innovation and Data Division (DTID) to build the working framework for data governance and data security
  • Bring the right data into A*STAR's analytics ecosystem, setup and operationalize the data pipelines, and ensuring performance and scalability when processing batch or real-time data
  • Ensure data quality through data profiling, data cleaning and other methods
  • Desensitize confidential information through masking or other methods
  • Ensure data security
  • Make sure business users can trust the data
  • Ensure business users spend less time on data preparation by simplifying the process
  • Design, construct, install, test and maintain data dashboards and data visualization
  • Work with data scientists in constructing and testing of data analytics models
Job Requirements
  • Degree or diploma in computer science, business analytics, science in data science and artificial Intelligence, software/computer engineering or relevant field.
  • Possess at least 3 years of experience working within a data engineering and/or data governance setting.
  • Ability in managing and communicating data system plans to process owners and business users.
  • Experience or knowledge of data governance and data security
  • Experience designing, building, and maintaining data processing systems.
  • Experience with or knowledge of Agile Software Development methodologies
  • Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service.
  • Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
  • Process oriented with great documentation skills.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills with a keen sense of customer service.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_description:
Scientist / Senior Scientist (Module Lead for FarBEOL Processes such as hybrid bonding, CMP, ECP), IME
Job Description:
Module development for Far Back End Of Line (FarBEOL) processes including Chemical-Mechanical Polishing (CMP), Wafer bonding, Debonding and Electrochemical Plating (ECP) which are required for advanced packaging, sensor actuator and power electronics applications. Senior Scientist will be part of heterogeneous integration group focused on development of the advanced packaging technology platforms. He/she will work with cross functional team to
  • Leading FarBEOL team, managing technical deliverables, timeline, and budgeting. Includes regular updates and engagement with various stakeholders.

  • Lead the negotiations with equipment vendors to upgrade the existing capabilities and to create new capabilities through collaboration
  • File patents/know-hows on new development activities.
  • Publish new findings and technological advancements in prestigious journals and overseas/local conferences.
Job Requirements
  • PhD in Electronics / Microelectronics / Material Engineering / Material Science / Chemistry / Physics.
  • Prior experience in CMP process development for more than 3 years in semiconductor industry.
  • Prior experience in wafer bonding, debonding and ECP processes is preferred.
  • Knowledge of advanced packaging technologies such as hybrid bonding, TSV, Cu damascene process would be an advantage.
  • Knowledge of FarBEOL equipment such as CMP, Wafer Bonding / Debonding, ECP is preferred.
  • Good analytical, communication and presentation skills.

About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore
A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.
NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).
Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.
Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.
For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg

job_title: Assistant Manager/ Manager, Population Health Finance Policy (Data Analytics)
company_overview:
SingHealth Community Hospitals (SCH) oversees the management of the three Community Hospitals under the SingHealth cluster - Bright Vision Hospital, and the new Sengkang Community Hospital and Outram Community Hospital coming up in 2018 and 2020 respectively.
SCH aims to deliver a seamless and integrated care path for patients requiring sub-acute, rehabilitation and palliative care. The focus is to bring value-driven outcomes for patients and set new standards of care for community hospitals. SCH is supported by the medical expertise and research capabilities of the SingHealth-Duke NUS Academic Medical Centre.
job_description:
You will report to the Assistant Director of Population Health Finance Policy section to assist with Bundled Payments, OneRehab and Population Health Financing, which are new MOH subvention/ funding frameworks at the cluster level. You will partner with various stakeholders and cross functional teams in the course of your work, especially the Finance offices within the cluster. 

For Bundled payments, you will assist the Assistant Director to ensure fair distribution of funding to all affected institutions within the cluster on a sound allocation basis. You will carry out analysis of Bundled episodes by leveraging on data from MOH as well as the cluster data warehouse to simulate financial sustainability, and highlight actionable insights for improvement and change. In addition, you are also expected to work with the relevant stakeholders to develop a framework to incentivize institutions towards fulfilling bundled payment outcomes. This entails involve regular monitoring of Bundled Care KPIs and reporting of anomaly performance on a quarterly basis, through performance dashboards at various forums. You are expected to assist Assistant Director as a key financial resource to provide value-added support to the clinical and operational partners in the bundled payments framework. You will also design and build financial models and simulations to support the decision making for Bundled Payments work.

You will also assist Assistant Director to develop financial policies to support Population Health projects that are closely aligned with Bundled Payments implementation and OneRehab. As part of the bundled payments implementation, you would also support the Institution Finance teams on the Costing Systemization (Cosy) project, so that you can understand how cost data are derived and eventually use the data to verify the norm costs for various types of bundles. You will also make use of the Cosy data for financial simulations, so as to optimize bundled payments funding. For OneRehab, you will look into the harmonised MT subsidy tiers and pricing structure to address any pricing gradient issues, track the Rehab costs and quantify the likely financial implications brought about by the changes under OneRehab. 

In addition, you will also assist Assistant Director to design and build financial models and simulations for patient population served by the cluster for Population Health Financing. You will also look into financial incentives that will inculcate patient’s personal stewardship towards preventive care and healthy living, as well as encourage patient “stickiness” and right-siting of care within the cluster to optimise the use of healthcare resources, in order to meet the long-term objectives and vision of Population Health led by MOH. 

You will look into innovative ways of streamlining data-mining processes and leverage data technologies that can better support the analytical demands of Population Health and Bundled Payments.

You will assist in ad-hoc projects as and when assigned.

Job Requirements

  •  Degree in Engineering with MBA or Degree in Business / Accounting with cross-disciplinary knowledge/ experience in Data Transformation and Analytics
  • For Assistant Manager position, at least 6 years of relevant working experience in Finance / Business Analytics or Data Analytics field
  • For Manager position, at least 8 years of relevant working experience in Finance / Business Analytics or Data Analytics field, preferably with at least 2 years of managerial / supervisory experience.
  • Prior experience in Management Accounting, Reporting, Costing, Financial Modelling and Multivariate Analysis
  • Prior working experience in a healthcare setting preferred
  • Able to work in a dynamic and fast paced environment
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), SAP, Data visualization applications such as Tableau, Power BI, Power-pivot DAX, SQL, SPSS and Programming languages such as R and Python
  • Passion and deep interest in working with rich Big Data sets and using BI techniques to data-mine and discover new actionable insights
  • Resourceful and think Out of the Box.
  • Goal getter with a Can-do attitude and willingness to take up challenges.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

company_overview:
DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. job_description:
A research scientist position is available immediately at the Institute for Infocomm Research (I2R), A*STAR, Singapore. The project focuses on development of machine learning, deep learning algorithms for analysis of streaming, irregularly sampled, and very high imbalanced time series data towards predictive maintenance of aircraft components.   • Contribute to UIBR (Use Inspired Basic Research) capabilities.
  • Working on real-world data sets towards predictive analytics applications
  • Working alongside a team of Scientists and Engineers to develop capabilities and develop deployable machine learning models.
The main objective is to develop such algorithms and showcase these key capabilities across a wide range of applications.

  • PhD in Computer science, computer engineering, mathematics and statistics, with expertise in deep learning, Concept Drift detection and adaptation, robust AI and uncertainty estimation, etc.
