company_overview:
Carro is an automotive marketplace that offers a full-stack service for all aspects of car ownership. By offering a trustworthy and transparent experience, Carro challenges the traditional way of buying and selling cars through a proprietary pricing algorithm.
Besides selling cars, Carro provides services that offer a car owner everything they need throughout their car ownership journey. In 2019, Carro introduced the First Car Subscription Service in Singapore. The new service aims to provide Singaporeans with a commitment-free car ownership experience, unlike the traditional.
Carro’s technology-driven services leverage innovation and technology to provide consumers with a seamless experience. These include an in-house financing solution through its sister company Genie Financial Services and a suite of after-sales services such as an in-house car care workshop and Singapore’s first on-demand roadside recovery platform. In 2020, Carro redefined the car buying experience with Singapore’s first contactless service, providing consumers with added assurance through a 3-day return policy and 30-day wear and tear guarantee. 
Best Funded Automotive Marketplace
Founded in 2015, Carro is Southeast Asia’s largest automotive marketplace, with the company having expanded to Thailand and Indonesia in 2017. Carro’s expansion coincides with exponential year-on-year growth, recording over US$100 million worth of transactions in 2016, with figures doubling to over US$250 million in 2017 and again doubling to US$500 million in 2018. In 2020, the total transactions stand at over US$1 billion.
In August 2019, Carro closed their Series B funding round at US$90 million. The round was supported by notable names such as SoftBank Ventures Asia, EDBI Pte Ltd, Insignia Ventures Partners, B Capital Group and many more. Overall, Carro has raised US$105 million since its inception. The funding has allowed the company to expand its presence across Southeast Asia and improve existing services in its automotive ecosystem.
job_description:
Singapore's No 1 fastest-growing company in 2021 is looking for a Product Analyst. We’re looking for analysts to harvest insights, and build a competitive advantage using predictive data to improve every aspect of our business, including our pricing strategies, demand and supply matching efficiencies, and operational excellence.

You will have ownership over important project areas that include defining the roadmap of product analytics. You will partner closely with Engineering, Product, Design and other stakeholders to help us make better data-driven decisions about our products.

What you will be doing:

  • Determine what needs to be tracked and measured. You will be responsible for tracking user interactions and clickstream data to understand customer behaviour
  • Evaluate and define product and business KPIs and metrics along with Product Managers and Product Designers
  • Democratize data by building customized dashboards & reports for relevant stakeholders
  • Offer deep dive analysis to key stakeholders across all teams and products, in order to determine product features and UX optimization strategies
  • Combined with the performance of product data, support the design of data strategy, data products, user portraits and other related data modules.
  • Analyse usage, conversion, adoption and retention data and share actionable insights across all the product teams
  • Explore and extract insights from dataset of car users and vehicle data, including behavioural, economic, and interaction of supply and demand on ours, and our partners' platforms across SEA
Requirements

What you will need:

  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or quantitative discipline
  • At least 3 years of professional experience in a similar role or quantitative/analytical field in the technology space (e.g. product analytics, data science, performance marketing, growth analytics, etc)
  • Excellent analytical and modelling skills, ideally with considerable proficiency in data analysis languages such as R, Python, and database SQL
  • Proven experience in using data to drive product development and decision-making, preferably working directly with engineers and a wider cross-functional product teams.
  • Experience with Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics and web analytics
  • Experience with creating dashboards and visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Google Data Studio, Looker and etc
  • Experience with tools such as Rudderstack is highly preferred
job_requirement_qualification: Not Specified

company_overview:
TTSH is one of Singapore’s largest multi-disciplinary hospitals with more than 174 years of pioneering medical care and development. The hospital has 45 clinical and allied health departments, 16 specialist centres. It also has three institutes that are spearheading care, research and innovations in geriatric medicine, infectious diseases and ophthalmology. Powered by more than 8,000 healthcare staff, TTSH sees over 2,500 patients at its specialist clinics and some 460 patients at its emergency department every day. TTSH is part of the National Healthcare Group, providing holistic and integrated patient care.  With a strong quality culture steeped in patient safety, TTSH constantly challenges itself to provide faster, better, cheaper and safer care for patients. To achieve this, the hospital keeps abreast and believes in investing in its staff, facilities, medical technology and system improvements.

More information is available at www.ttshhr.com
job_description:
JOB SUMMARY
  1. To oversee all aspects of epidemiology required for research in Tan Tock Seng Hospital, including study design, reduction of bias and confounding factors, preparation of data collection databases, power calculation, and data analysis (in collaboration with the Biostatistician),

  2.  To support TTSH clinician and allied health Principal Investigators in grant applications and manuscript publication

  3. To teach on epidemiology and statistics-related topics
MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESSPECIFIC
  1. Operational
  1. Work closely with clinician and allied health Principal Investigators and biostatisticians in designing research studies and clinical trials, and data management.
    • Formulate and review research questions, study objectives, testable hypothesis, and definition of specific relevant outcome endpoints

    •  Select and review appropriate target population and eligibility criteria
  • Create case definition(s), identify time frame (recruitment and follow-up) and select design taking into account logistical and time constraints

  • Identify sources of bias and methods to minimize them

  • Identify potential confounders and strategies to minimize them

  • Identify sampling methods given the context of the situation

  • Provide sample size/power calculations and justifications
    • Generate and oversee generation of randomization codes for study allocation

    • Review data collection instruments using new or existing information systems (in collaboration with CRIO data managers where necessary)

    • Review database requirements, such as inclusion of the necessary variables and data dictionary

    • Assist in the co-ordination among all groups involved in the study

 
  1. Provides statistical analysis (using SPSS, Stata, R etc.) and results interpretation.
    • Define and review analysis plan to ensure that study objectives are met

    •  Identify and validate the choice of statistical techniques

    • Specify and validate the parameters to estimate

    • Specify and validate the assumptions to be used in interpreting results

    • Create and validate datasets for analysis

    • Conduct analysis of data, including descriptive summary statistics, univariate tests, measures of association, multivariable analysis, and longitudinal trend analysis

    • Interpret and review the interpretation of measures of association, confidence intervals, and p-values

    • Create and review reports and necessary components, including tables, graphs, and charts for presentation and publication

    • Evaluate conclusions and interpretations, assess validity and reliability of data collection instruments and methods, and any other potential limitation.

  2. Provide support for clinician and allied health Principal Investigators in grant applications;
    • Review competitive grant proposals to ensure   completeness and compliance with grant instructions, and sound research & ethics principles

    • In collaboration with team biostatisticians, assists with writing the relevant sections of grant proposals including but not limited to study protocols & biostatistical methodologies

    • Upon successful grant applications, to assist Principal Investigators in resolving problems encountered including scope change, turnaround time delays, authorship disagreements etc.)

  3. Provide support for clinician and allied health Principal Investigators in getting their research published by;
    • Suggesting appropriate journals for publication depending on manuscript focus

    • Assist in preparing manuscripts that are journal publication ready (i.e. meeting journal publication guidelines)

    • Assisting with literature search and review

    • Review selection of methods, and content for communication of study findings and assist in deciding relevance/representation of data to report and identifying inconsistencies in data/other content presented

    • Evaluates information to be included in manuscript drafts with regard to content (quality and relevance), audience (appropriate and relevant to audience needs), and context (credibility of cited sources and suitability of purpose).

    •   Assists Principal Investigators address reviewers' feedback

    • Review written summary reports for use within the institution, abstracts either for publication or for presentation at scientific meetings, and manuscripts for scientific publications

 
  1. Assists in creating slides/posters, either for communication in scientific meeting or for institutional communications, that are effective in conveying complex key messages, and appropriate for the intended audience

  2. Shares knowledge and provide training for epidemiology and statistics-related topics in courses organized by CRIO. Staff will also be encouraged to teach on writing and presentation skills. Where necessary, support for staff attending such courses will be provided.

  3. Applies principles of good ethical and scientific practice (e.g., data and safety monitoring) as they relate to study design, data collection, dissemination, and any further use of the information collected or gained

  4. To develop knowledge and expertise (through attending relevant courses) in domains where CRIO in-house expertise may be lacking. These would include mixed-method research designs, survey research methods, systematic review, meta-analysis and innovation methodologies. To assist PIs in identifying resources in and outside of organization when help is needed.
GENERAL  
  1. Assemble databases and other sources of information, such as the electronic medical literature, for analysis of health questions.

  2. Support special projects as requested by managerial, administrative or operational staff

  3. Perform any other duties as assigned by the Supervisor / Head of department including taking on administrative duties

  4. Actively participate as a member or team lead for quality improvement projects of Hospital-wide / Departmental level

  5. Constantly evaluate and make continuous improvement to the Epidemiology work processes

JOB REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION

  • Preferably a medicine or science basic degree (BSc, MBBS or MD or BSc Nursing) but other candidates (eg. With degree in Psychology) may also apply.

  • At least MSc qualification. The postgraduate degree should be in Public Health or Epidemiology.
PRE-REQUISITES
  1. Proficient in MS office applications and statistical software.

  2. Ability and have strong interest in research.

  3. Able to follow a problem to conclusion. Able to identify complex problems and retrieve information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.

  4. Able to work with a variety of people and have a congenial personality.

  5. Able to speak and write effectively.

  6. Able to exercise patience, flexibility and willingness to work under a variety of conditions.
EXPERIENCE
At least one year of postgraduate experience, working in epidemiology-related fields or in public health.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

job_description:
Job Description
Senior Scientist will be part of heterogeneous integration group focused on development of the advanced packaging technology platforms to enable System-in-Package through integration of chiplets.
He/she will work with cross functional team to
  • Lead the development of advanced bonding processes for 2.5D/3D IC and 3D FOWLP integration, including
  • W2W and C2W hybrid bonding with ultra-fine pitch, high density interconnects.
  • Fusion bonding for multiple wafer stacking.
  • Temporary Bonding and De-bonding for FOWLP, Si Interposer, TSV applications.
  • Lead the capabilities roadmap development for W2W & C2W technologies
  • Establish design rules and PDK for W2W and C2W hybrid bonding technologies required for IDMs, Fabless, Foundries and OSAT companies.
  • Work with technical and business development team to initiate new industry consortia projects with supply chain companies.
  • Collaborate with other programs, A*STAR institutes, IHLs for research grant projects proposals preparation.
  • Collaborate with equipment, materials suppliers and end user for the development of emerging packaging technologies such as 3D IC or 3D stacked memory.
  • Lead the negotiations with equipment vendors to upgrade the existing capabilities and to create new capabilities through collaboration
Job Requirements
  • PhD in Electronic / Microelectronics / Material Engineering / Chemical Engineering / Chemistry / Physics or related field with proven academic and industry experience.
  • More than 10 years of hands-on experience and knowledge in various 2.5D/3D bonding processes, including TBDB, hybrid bonding, fusion bonding.
  • Deep knowledge of the fundamentals and mechanisms in bonding processes.
  • Good knowledge of advanced packaging technologies such as TSV, Cu damascene, FOWLP would be an advantage.
  • Good analytical, communication and presentation skills.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_description:
﻿
The protein Analytics group at BTI is working to innovate process analytical technology (PAT) in biotherapeutics and the biomanufacturing process. The open position is required to utilize liquid-chromatography-mass spectrometry (LCMS)-based techniques for robust and streamlined protein quality attributes characterization and comprehensive proteome and PTM profiling.  As self-motivated personnel, you will be expected to work independently and closely with industry collaborators and multiple disciplinary team members to address critical challenges in robust at-line and real-time analysis of proteins and provide innovative solutions.
JOB REQUIREMENT:
  • 1. Ph.D. degree in mass spectrometry, proteomics, analytical chemistry, protein sciences, biochemistry, or related life science disciplines.
  • 2. Three years of hands-on protein analytics work experience includes protein sample preparation (extraction, quantitation, separation, enzyme digestion, desalting), liquid chromatography coupled mass spectrometry data acquisition, and data analysis.
  • 3. General knowledge of biopharmaceuticals manufacturing and bioprocessing, analytical regulations. Data analytics and Bioinformatics, capable of R programming language, will be desirable
  • 4. Good communicative and writing skills, track record of communicating research findings through publications in peer-reviewed journals
  • 5. Ability to work effectively as an individual and as a team player
  • 6. Keen willingness and humility to teach and learn from fellow teammates
  • 7. Strong organizational skills with attention to detail are critical
  • 8. Flexibility to adapt to changing environment and project priorities/timelines
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology (SIMTech) is seeking a highly motivated and experienced research scientist or senior research scientist in the field of AI in Manufacturing. The successful candidate will play the role of technical and/or management leadership in the Manufacturing System Division (MSD).
Some of the key roles & responsibilities include:
  • Understanding the technology trends and changes and develop impactful programmes/proposal towards successful competitive funding
  • Have a deep understanding on the state-of-the-art AI/Machine Learning/Optimization models/algorithms for problem solving in manufacturing context, in particular for the shopfloor domain
  • Research and develop new models and algorithms for problems in Smart Manufacturing domain, testing these algorithms in live production environment and eventually transferring robust algorithms to the industry
  • Familiar with Industry 4.0 standards and concepts will be an added advantage
Job Requirements:
  • PhD or Eng. Doc in Computer Science/Engineering, Operations Research, Mechanical, Electrical or relevant discipline
  • With 7 years of relevant experience
  • Able to work with different stakeholders; internal, agencies and industry and able to coalesce the differing demands into aligned needs
  • Able to lead, plan, coordinate and mentor a team of scientists and engineers
  • Able to understand new needs and quickly understand the manufacturing environment in Singapore and its connection to the rest of the world
  • Strong communication skills, including written, presentation and able to articulate complex ideas simply

company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:

job_description:
The Genome Institute of Singapore (GIS) is an institute of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR). It has a global vision that seeks to use genomic sciences to achieve extraordinary improvements in human health and public prosperity. GIS is dedicated to creating a social culture that is focused on excellence, knowledge sharing, individual initiative and coordinated action. We have focused on recruiting and rewarding excellent people and establishing systems that will sustain this culture of excellence. Our scientists come from all five continents, from industrial and academic positions and from diverse disciplines. This diversity is unified in the pursuit of science for public health and prosperity.
Postdoctoral fellows: Machine Learning and Mathematical Analysis of Spatial Transcriptomics Data (Genome Institute of Singapore)
The Single-Cell In Situ Spatial Omics at subcellular Resolution (SCISSOR) team is looking for smart, motivated machine learning and data analytics researchers who can lead or contribute to the development of new imaging-based methods for understanding and diagnosing cancer.  The candidate should have strong mathematical intuition and programming skills, and be comfortable working in a highly collaborative multidisciplinary environment that includes biologists, imaging technologists, pathologists and medical oncologists. This will be a unique opportunity to work on new data types and ask new questions in the rapidly growing field of spatial Omics.
SCISSOR is a well-supported multidisciplinary program that creates spatial and non-spatial genomic technologies, applies them to clinical samples, generates massive multimodal datasets and interprets them to infer the molecular drivers of tumor growth and response to immunotherapy and other treatments. We have a track record of combining cutting-edge computational and experimental approaches to infer disease mechanisms and develop clinical applications (Chen et al., Science 2015; Li et al., Nat Genet 2017; Sun et al., Cell 2016; Fukawa et al., Nat Med 2016; del Rosario et al., Nat Methods 2015; Kumar et al., Nat Biotechnol 2013; Ku et al., Lancet Oncol 2012).
Requirements
  • PhD in mathematics, computer science, statistics, engineering, machine learning, signal processing, computer vision, computational genomics, or a related field
  • Experience with analysis and interpretation of genomic data
    • Strong programming skills
    • Quantitative intuition, and some mathematical maturity
    • Strong publication record
    • Strong communication skills
    • The ability to work closely with clinicians and experimental biologists
To apply, please email your CV and names of references to prabhakars@gis.a-star.edu.sg, arulrayan@gis.a-star.edu.sg
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

The candidate will drive the developments of Physics-Informed Machine Learning (PIML) models in the frameworks of Physic-based Artificial Intelligence for Engineering Modelling and Design and apply the frameworks to the real-world problems.
The scope of work includes
  • Build PIML models for components, subsystems of complex multiscale, multiphysics engineering systems based on data obtained from experiments or extracted from numerical simulations and additional information from mathematical formulations and boundary conditions that governs the systems.
  • The development of PIML models includes the foundation methodologies for incorporating the governing physics into the ML models.
  • Couple the PIML models with other models including Reduced Order Model to improve their prediction capabilities.
  • Interact with domain experts in the team to better understand the problems and acquire domain knowledge for the constructions of the PIML models.
  • Collaborate with industry partners, affiliated research institutes and other relevant stakeholders
Job Requirements
  • PhD from reputable universities in Computer Science, Engineering or other relevant disciplines.
  • Having backgrounds in engineering (e.g. fluid dynamics, solid mechanics) and in numerical methods (e.g. Finite Volume, Finite Element).
  • Experience with data driven modeling, Machine Learning, Neural Net, Deep Learning.
  • Strong skills in multi-language programming (e.g. C++, C#, Python, Matlab)
  • Experience in customizing open-source programs
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills; Ability to adapt and work effectively as members of a team; Strong communication and excellent writing skills; Resourceful and self-driven with a high degree of profressional integrity.

company_overview:
AMD (NYSE: AMD) is a semiconductor design innovator leading the next era of vivid digital experiences with its groundbreaking AMD Accelerated Processing Units (APUs) that power a wide range of computing devices. AMD’s server computing products are focused on driving industry-leading cloud computing and virtualization environments. AMD’s superior graphics technologies are found in a variety of solutions ranging from game consoles, PCs to supercomputers.
AMD, Singapore is the Product Development Center (SPDC) for AMD as well as its Asia Pacific regional headquarters for AMD Sales & Marketing.

Established in 1984, AMD Singapore is an engineering site leveraging the differentiated engineering expertise and unique eco-system for product bring-up and sample generation enabling timely product launches, higher test cost margins and the quality expectations of our customers.

AMD SPDC actively taps into the large talent pool from the region. Today its highly sophisticated and efficient engineering operations environments are equipped with high-end engineering laboratories that support New Product Bring-up, Customer Samples Generation, Device Analysis, Reliability Testing, Surface Mount Board Assembly Evaluations, Packaging Characterization, Platform Validation and Hardware Debug.

AMD SPDC strives to recruit and retain the best talent, making it not only a great place to work but also an integral part of the AMD family by continuing to contribute significantly to AMD’s success.
job_description:
Data Analytics Engineer (SQL)

The Role:
The Analytics Engineer acts as the bridge between data engineers and data analysts. It is their job to build well tested, up to date and documented datasets that the rest of the company can use to answer their own questions. AMD's environment is fast paced, results oriented and built upon a legion of forward-thinking people with a passion for winning technology!

Key Responsibilities:
1. Build data products that enable partners to do their jobs effectively.
2. Analyze and organize raw data to build data systems, algorithms, prototypes and pipelines.
3. Prepare data for prescriptive and predictive modeling to evaluate business needs and achieve objectives.
4. Use tools and techniques to visualize data in easy-to-understand formats.
5. Work with multi-functional collaborators to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.

Requirements:
1. BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
2. Knowledge of Businesses Intelligence
3. Advanced working SQL knowledge. You should possess ability to write SQL which is easy to understand, simple to solve and that is highly performant.
4. Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
5. Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and find opportunities for improvement.
6. Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
7. Strong project management and organizational skills.

Preferred Requirements:
1. Comfortable adopting software engineering standard methodologies like version control and using Git and teaching others how to adopt these practices.
2. Experience with SQL, NoSQL databases, including MySQL, Oracle, Snowflake, etc
3. Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, R, etc.
4. Experience with data warehousing solutions, and ETL tools
5. Experience with PowerBI, Azure, DevOps, dbt
6. Experience with machine learning
7. Knowledge of Big Data-related skills like MapReduce, etc

Location:
Singapore
AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers and will consider all applicants without regard to race, marital status, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law. EOE/MFDV

company_overview: Avensys is a leader in providing technology enabled business solutions and services. Since inception, Avensys has helped clients use IT more efficiently to improve their operations and profitability, focus on core competencies and achieve business results such as increased agility, innovation and profitable growth. Our in-depth technical knowledge coupled with industry experience and our unique methodologies enable us to successfully deliver and meet our customer’s expectations.
job_description:
Avensys is a reputed global IT professional services company headquartered in Singapore. Our service spectrum includes enterprise solution consulting, business intelligence, business process automation and managed services. Given our decade of success we have evolved to become one of the top trusted providers in Singapore and service a client base across banking and financial services, insurance, information technology, healthcare, retail and supply chain.
We are currently looking to hire Senior Data Scientist. This is an exciting opportunity to expand your skill set, achieve job satisfaction and work-life balance. More details as below.
JOB TYPE
Contract
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
  • Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
  • Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
  • Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
  • Combine models through ensemble modeling
  • Present information using data visualization techniques
  • Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
  • Collaborate with engineering and product development teams
REQUIREMENTS
  • About 2-3 years of relevant working experience
  • Must have strong hands-on experience in Python
  • Understanding on Machine Learning technics, Neural Network, Linear regression, sentiment analysis, Clustering, anomaly detection, NLP, chatbot, Topic Modelling, Entity Recognition
  • Must have a very good understanding and hands-on on BERT model. Need to have the experience of unfreeze different layer of BERT and re-train the BERT model.
  • Must have experience in NER (Named Entity Recognition), able to extract contents from unstructured text.
  • Knowledge in any of the DBs: SQL (Oracle, MySQL, MariaDB)
  • Development in Linux: basic Linux/Unix preferred
  • Experience a plus in UI presentation, QlikSense, Power BI, R Shiny, orD3.js
WHAT’S ON OFFER
You will be remunerated with an excellent base salary and entitled to attractive company benefits. Additionally, you will get the opportunity to enjoy a fun and collaborative work environment, alongside a strong career progression.
To submit your application, please apply online or email your UPDATED CV in Microsoft Word format to felcy@aven-sys.com .Your interest will be treated with strict confidentiality.
 
CONSULTANT DETAILS
Consultant Name: Felcy Esther
Avensys Consulting Pte Ltd
EA License 12C5759

job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow (nanopore sequencing and DNA/RNA/XNA engineering technology)
company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.
job_description:
﻿
The Laboratory of Synthetic Biology and Genome Editing Therapeutics at the Genome Institute of Singapore is seeking talented and ambitious Postdocs to join its team.Job Description
The successful candidates will develop new technologies for (i) nanopore sequencing (ii) scalable error-corrected DNA/RNA/XNA synthesis and assembly, (iii) directed evolution and protein engineering of nucleic-acid modifying enzymes, and/or (iv) developing machinery that controls single-molecular reactions. The successful candidates will be part of a team of vibrant and talented scientists with diverse research interests and capabilities.
Job Requirements
  • Ph.D. in Biological Sciences, Engineering, or related disciplines
  • Excellent expertise with molecular biology, nanopore sequencing, programming, micro/nanofludics, and/or robotics is a pre-requisite
  • Demonstrated independence and creativity
  • Ability to generate intellectual property is highly desirable
job_requirement_qualification: Doctorate (PhD)

job_description:
The candidate will drive the developments of Physics-Informed Machine Learning (PIML) models in the frameworks of Physic-based Artificial Intelligence for Engineering Modelling and Design and apply the frameworks to the real-world problems.
The scope of work includes
  • Build PIML models for components, subsystems of complex multiscale, multiphysics engineering systems based on data obtained from experiments or extracted from numerical simulations and additional information from mathematical formulations and boundary conditions that governs the systems.
  • The development of PIML models includes the foundation methodologies for incorporating the governing physics into the ML models.
  • Couple the PIML models with other models including Reduced Order Model to improve their prediction capabilities.
  • Interact with domain experts in the team to better understand the problems and acquire domain knowledge for the constructions of the PIML models.
  • Collaborate with industry partners, affiliated research institutes and other relevant stakeholders
Job Requirements
  • PhD in Computer Science, Engineering or other relevant disciplines.
  • Having backgrounds in engineering (e.g. fluid dynamics, solid mechanics) and in numerical methods (e.g. Finite Volume, Finite Element).
  • Experience with data driven modeling, Machine Learning, Neural Net, Deep Learning.
  • Strong skills in multi-language programming (e.g. C++, C#, Python, Matlab)
  • Experience in customizing open-source programs
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills; Ability to adapt and work effectively as members of a team; Strong communication and excellent writing skills; Resourceful and self-driven with a high degree of profressional integrity.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
job_requirement_qualification: Doctorate (PhD)

job_description:
Job Description
We are looking for candidates with the talent and passion to pursue first class research in Machine Learning (ML) and automated ML. You will be expected to conduct research, design and develop cutting edge models and algorithms for automating the machine learning process (e.g. automated data pre-processing, feature engineering, algorithm selection and hyperparameter tuning). You will also be expected to work closely with the researchers from IHPC to develop in-house capability in these areas. The successful candidates will have the opportunities to collaborate closely with researchers and practitioners from other A*STAR institutes, as well as industry partners to translate the developed solutions for tackling real world modelling and data analytics problems confronted today and in near future.
Requirements
  • Strong interest and capability in machine learning and automated machine learning.
  • Experience in analysing data using machine learning would be an advantage.
  • Excellent programming experience in Python.
  • Experience in other programming languages like Javascript, Java, R, C++ and Scala is a plus.
  • Smart and hardworking individual who can work under pressure within a tight deadline
  • A good team player with can-do attitude
  • Solid communication skills and problem-solving skills
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_title: Scientist / Senior Scientist [Lithography Process and Equipment], IME
company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.
job_description:
Lithography is generally critical gating module, with most number of repeated processes across various semiconductor technology and product development needs. IME’s lithography needs are extremely diversified -- from sub-micron features, high-aspect-ratio with high topography for MEMS to 10’s of nm with immersion for photonics & mmwave devices, and ultra-thick resists/polymers upon different types of wafers for heterogeneous integrations.
IME is looking for an experienced Lithography Process and Equipment Engineer to support lithography process development and process maintenance across 3 programs, namely MEMS, Wideband Gap, and Heterogeneous Integration at three different sites (Science Park-2, Ang Mo Kio, and Fusionopolis).
Candidate must be responsible for the following:
  • Develop and maintain litho process on Si, Glass and SiC wafers (6” to 12” diameters).
  • Design and qualify inline process control test structures relevant to these 3 technology platforms.
  • Review tape-out form and conduct process release for new tape-outs including creation of job files creation & litho margin study.
  • Review tool/process SPC (recipe/frequency) and highlight issues and solution in Fab/Process Module meetings.
  • Participate in Design-Of-Experiments (DOE) & data analysis for solving integration problems as member of quality improvement teams.
  • Review post PM qualification / escalation reports to make decision on equipment release.
  • Document and maintain all process developments and baselines/BKMs for Process Review-Board meetings and records.
  • Participate in customer meetings on as litho subject matter expert
Job Requirements
  • PhD in Science or Engineering discipline
  • 5 to 8 years of industry / R&D organization experience in lithography
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree

job_title: Scientist [Knowledge Engineering] | Social & Cognitive Computing, IHPC
company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.
job_description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
(Research Scientist in Knowledge engineering; Knowledge extraction; Knowledge graphs; Graph Reasoning; Artificial Intelligence)
Social and Cognitive Computing department at the Institute of High Performance Computing, A*STAR, Singapore invites applicants with passion to conduct R&D in knowledge engineering with experience in knowledge extraction, representation, and modeling; knowledge graphs and reasoning techniques. You will be part of our team developing decision support and question answering systems based on automatically constructed knowledge bases from multiple sources.
A successful candidate will be involved in some or all of the following tasks:
  • Perform research in knowledge extraction and modeling / knowledge graphs / knowledge-based reasoning systems.
  • Evaluate developed systems with use cases motivated by industry.
  • Actively collaborate with other researchers in R&D activities including scientific publication and grant proposal writing, system development, testing and deployment of intelligent systems.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
  • PhD in computer science, information systems, or a related field
  • A good scientific track record and practical experience in some of the following fields: natural language processing, knowledge engineering, knowledge bases and reasoning systems, computational and artificial intelligence, cognitive systems
  • Being a team player with good communication skills
  • Strong skills in scripting languages (e.g. Python)
  • Experience in graph learning and language models
  • Experience in graph databases like Neo4j, TigerGraph, etc.
  • Strong skills in functional programming and languages like LISP or Clojure
  • Experience in designing and performing a grant project
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
job_requirement_qualification: Doctorate (PhD)

company_overview:
SingHealth Community Hospitals (SCH) oversees the management of the three Community Hospitals under the SingHealth cluster - Bright Vision Hospital, and the new Sengkang Community Hospital and Outram Community Hospital coming up in 2018 and 2020 respectively.
SCH aims to deliver a seamless and integrated care path for patients requiring sub-acute, rehabilitation and palliative care. The focus is to bring value-driven outcomes for patients and set new standards of care for community hospitals. SCH is supported by the medical expertise and research capabilities of the SingHealth-Duke NUS Academic Medical Centre.
job_description:
You will be reporting to the Manager of Financial Analytics under the Strategic Finance team, and you will be required to:

  • Provide data analytics support (including development of Machine Learning models) for Bundled Payments and Population Health, and develop dashboards within the SingHealth Group.
  • Be part of the team to work on data analytics projects that are commissioned by institutions within the SingHealth Group and provide recommendations on the financial analysis done.
  • Work with other institutions on the Ministry of Health Cozy (Costing Systemization) project and be the cluster support for this system after implementation.
  • One of your focus area will be on Capitation, which includes the developmental framework for Population Health analysis, Capitation funding models and all ETL processes in the management and maintenance of Population Health databases, registries and data analytics platforms. 
  • Support other Population Health programmes, which includes Full Acute Bundle, AH-CH bundle, One Rehab pilot, Tampines Capitation pilot amongst others. 
  • Provide the necessary training to SingHealth Community Hospitals’ Finance team on financial analytics tool.
  • Assist in projects, as and when assigned.

Requirements

  • Master's Degree/ Degree in Finance/ Statistics/ Mathematics/ Computer Science/ Engineering/ Business Analytics
  • Preferably at least 5-7 years of relevant working experience
  • Strong theoretical understanding of financial/ statistical modelling, machine learning, data mining and related techniques
  • Experience with data wrangling, data preparation and building visualisation dashboards with Tableau/ Qlik Sense/ Power BI preferred
  • Experience with algorithms and coding proficiency with tools such as R/ Python/ SQL preferred
  • Good understanding of MATLAB, SPSS, STATA preferred
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)
  • Team player, independent and able to work in a dynamic and fast paced environment
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree

job_description:
Research Scientist/Project Scientist (Cultivated Meat - Biomanufacturing Technology) BTI﻿
Job Details
Job Responsibilities
(Cultivated Meat/Cellular Agriculture - Biomanufacturing Technology)
We are seeking a highly motivated and hands-on skilled scientist with either tissue engineering or food technology background to be involved in our materials manufacturing efforts for Cultivated Meat under the CRISP Meats Programme as well as other Cell Ag initiatives, which would eventually end up as edible products. The successful candidate will work within a highly interdisciplinary R&D team of scientists and engineers to develop and translate next-generation hybrid organoleptic Cultivated Meat and Cell Ag products based on scale-up biomanufacturing processes and lean materials processing.
The key roles of the position are to:
  • Develop and finetune next-generation plant-based Cell Ag products/scaffolds/composites/hydrogels/aerogels/microcarriers/cell culture supports with targeted organoleptic and nutritional properties
  • Perform detailed characterisation of materials and 3D scaffolds (mechanical, biochemical, physical characterisations etc.)
  • Investigate cost-effective sterilisation, packaging, storage/shipping, and shelf-life of developed materials/products
  • Perform detailed literature review; design, and execute experiments based on proposed project scope
  • Collect experimental data, analyse, interpret results, and plan the next step
  • Update project progress regularly; prepare presentation decks for internal and external meetings and prepare final project reports
  • Opportunities to lead industry collaboration efforts with start-ups and MNCs
  • Lead in writing research papers  
Job Requirements
  • A PhD in Bioengineering/Biomedical Engineering/Materials Eng/Biochemical Engineering/Materials Science/ Biological Sciences/ Food Science and Technology or equivalent with commensurate experience of 2 years.
  • Proven research productivity with a good publication record and first-authored papers is a must
  • Strong background and hands-on experience in either tissue engineering, biomaterial formulations, biofunctionalisation, biofabrication/printing OR Food process engineering and technologies
  • Broad experience with analytical and material characterisation techniques -tensile/compression tests, texture analyser, Rheology,  Particle size & zeta potential analyser, Colorimeter, FTIR, NMR, TGA, XPS, SEM/FESEM, AFM etc.
  • Preferred experience with animal cell culture, cell viability assays, cell staining, cell functional assays etc.
  • Background in molecular biology will be beneficial
  • Background in plant tissue culture will be highly beneficial
  • Background in fermentation will be highly beneficial 
  • Excellent analytical, writing and communication skills as well as Microsoft Office (with strength in Excel data analysis)
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, including critical and analytical thinking
  • Strong desire to learn new biomanufacturing advancements and flexibility to adapt to changing environments and project priorities/timelines
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
job_requirement_qualification: Doctorate (PhD)

job_title: Senior Associate/Associate, Business Analyst, DBS Transformation - (WD31695)
company_overview:
DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.
DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.
DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.
With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.
job_description:
Business Function

As business analyst in Future of Work (FoW) you will work together with various business units to build the best workplace and deliver best employee experience within the bank. You will take care of data analytics, visualisation and reporting for on-going employee experience enhancement initiatives. We'll require your regular engagement with relevant business stakeholders and work closely with the technology delivery teams, to ensure timeliness and quality of the delivery of data, model, and business insights.
Responsibilities:
  • Conduct strategic data analysis on employee experience, identify area for improvement and make strategic recommendations to executive and senior management, develop data stories that clearly communicate complex analysis, models and ideas
  • Work closely with technology team to analyse, formulise and source in the needed data to address business problem and provide valuable insights
  • Design and execute primary research like bank wide surveys to collect perceptive employee data, feedback and insights
  • Maximize data capabilities focusing on employee science in areas such as predictive/ prescriptive/ text analytics
  • Develop and maintain business dashboards with Tableau and other visualisation tools to support regular business reporting, data storytelling and data driven enhancements
  • Perform exploratory statistics and data mining tasks on diverse datasets from small scale to 'big data'
Requirements:
  • Degree (and above) in Information technology, Computer science, Statistics, Applied mathematics, Business analytics, or equivalent quantitative fields preferred

job_title: Research Fellow (Wound Care Innovation for the Tropics), A*SRL
company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.
job_description:
﻿
The Wound Care in the Tropics programme is looking for a Research Fellow to join the research team focusing on developing scaffolds (including but not limited to hydrogels and micro particles) to deliver proteins for soft tissue repair. This potential candidate should fulfil the following requirements:
  • Ph.D. level scientist with relevant background and experience (e.g. Materials Science & Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Chemical Engineering) or applicant with M.Eng with relevant experience can be considered (position title will be (Senior) Research Officer).
  • Experience in scaffold fabrication techniques such as electrospinning, 3D bioprinting, microgel fabrication, and nanoparticle formation
  • Strong ability to communicate effectively orally and in written form
  • Able to perform self-directed work
  • Motivated individual passionate in developing a product that could potentially be translated for patients use
  • Experience with material modification is a bonus
  • Some key responsibilities of this candidate include but are not limited to:
    • Design and characterise novel tissue engineering scaffolds that are biodegradable and biocompatible for soft tissue engineering
    • Incorporate proteins, characterise protein release kinetics and study bioactivity of released proteins from the designed scaffolds
    • Characterise physical scaffold properties (e.g. SEM imaging and degradation rate of material)
    • Interpret experimental results from journal papers in areas that are related to the research interest
    • Work in a collaborative inter-institute environment
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_description:
Experienced in manipulating data sets and building statistical models on advanced data tools

Your new company
My client is a cryptocurrency platform, offering crypto traders an ultra-fast matching engine, excellent customer service and multilingual community support and providing innovative online spot and derivatives trading services, mining and staking products, as well as API support. They are expanding in global market and increasing headcounts in Singapore as a regional hub.

Your new role
As a Data Scientist, you will support the sales teams with insights gained from analysing social and company data and work with global team together.

The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

  • Strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations.
  • Mine and analyse data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
  • Use predictive modelling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
  • Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyse model performance and data accuracy
  • Passionate about discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.



What you'll need to succeed

  • someone has 2-6 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models,
  • Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development.
  • Experience using statistical computer languages to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Experience working with and creating data architectures.
  • Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: C, C++, Java,
  • Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.



What you'll get in return

  • Global exposure
  • Career progression
  • Flexible company culture


What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact Eva Ma at +65 63030158 or email Eva.ma@hays.com.sg for a confidential discussion on your career. Hays Registration Number: 200609504D, EA License: 07C3924, Registration ID Number: R1658977

company: National Cancer Centre Singapore Pte Ltd
company_overview:
The National Cancer Centre Singapore (NCCS) has evolved over the past 20 years to become one of the leading regional centres for cancer treatment and research. It has pioneered the one-stop multi-disciplinary approach to cancer treatment and is now home to oncologists, surgeons and researchers, dedicated to the care and treatment of a growing number of cancer patients.

Today, NCCS see close to 65 per cent of the public sector oncology cases in Singapore. To deliver the latest cancer care and treatment, clinicians work closely with researchers who conduct robust cutting-edge clinical and translational research which has received international recognition.

NCCS strives to be a global leading cancer centre, and shares its expertise and knowledge by training the next generation of medical professionals.
job_description:
Research positions are available for motivated and ambitious candidates to join the dynamic Laboratory of Molecular Carcinogenesis (LMC) at the National Cancer Centre Singapore. LMC investigates the underlying mechanisms of tumorigenesis and drug resistance development, with a focus on the p53/p73 tumor-suppressor pathway. Major efforts are also underway to develop novel therapeutic modalities for cancer treatment, including the development of mutation-specific antibodies and siRNAs.

We are looking for candidates who have extensive experience in antibody-engineering OR siRNA-engineering technologies. Strong competence in cellular and molecular biology techniques is essential. Candidates with experience in genomic analysis and CRISPR-based gene-editing screens are also encouraged to apply.

Requirements:

- Ph.D. (for Research Fellow), M.Sc. (for Research Associate), or B.Sc. Hons (for Research Officer), with relevant experience in the disciplines of molecular & cell biology, antibody or siRNA engineering;

- Record of peer-reviewed publications (for Research Fellow and Research Associate positions);

- Ability to work independently, while being able to work together to support team-efforts;

- Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills, with demonstration of well-organized scientific documentation;

- Experience in supervision of graduate students and junior research staff is advantageous for Research Fellow and Research Associate positions.

Applicants should send the curriculum vitae with an introductory letter indicating experience, a concise description of research interests & future plans and three references to:

Dr. Kanaga Sabapathy,

Head and Professor,

Division of Cellular and Molecular Research,

National Cancer Centre, 11, Hospital Crescent, Singapore 169610

For more info, visit: www.thesabapathylab.com

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_title: Research Scientist [Polymer Technology Group | Composites], SIMTech
company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.
job_description:
Polymer Technology Group (PTG) is inviting applications for a Research Scientist position in Advanced Thermoplastic Composites Research. The successful applicant will have the opportunity to join a multi-disciplinary, multi-organization research program to participate in the development of process technologies for carbon fibre reinforced thermoplastic (CFRTP) components. This position shall involve system design, process development, and validation of thermoforming process solutions for commercial and developmental CFRTP material systems. The goal is to encourage greater adoption of sustainable materials and help companies acquire the process technologies needed to make the transition from thermoset to thermoplastic composites.
Responsibilities:
  • Develop and validate original or improved thermoforming process solutions for CFRTP composites to achieve industry acceptable standards for part accuracy, quality, yield, cycle times and finishing.
  • Able to handle tooling design, machinery modification and system integration works that will enable experimentation with new process concepts.
  • Conduct risk assessment, develop safe work procedures for modified systems and processes, and provide training to staff and students.
  • Study the thermo-mechanical properties and forming behaviours of CFRTP composites to understand the critical process parameters for thermoforming.
  • Champion process technology demonstrations with research program collaborators and industry adoption partners.  
  • Applicant should have genuine passion for forming technology research and is comfortable with physical activities, like mold changes, equipment set up and safety checks, and working with high temperature processes.
Job Requirements:
  • Ph.D. in Mechanical or Aeronautical Engineering. Candidates from other disciplines with relevant research or industry experience in process engineering, automation and/or thermoplastic processing will also be considered.
  • With 5 years of research or industry work experience with thermoplastics and/or fibre reinforced structural composites.
  • Strong in experimental research and technical work, understands equipment hardware/software specifications and able to handle process equipment modifications.
  • Familiar with thermal and mechanical characterization for polymer composites.
  • Familiar with 5S housekeeping system, have some laboratory/shopfloor operation management experience or health and safety management experience.
  • Experience in CAD design, AniForm or Abacus will be advantageous.
  • Strong publication track record that commensurate with experience and familiarity with research grant applications will be advantageous.
  • Proactive team player with good interpersonal, presentation, writing and communication skills.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

company_overview:
About Nanyang Technological University, Singapore
A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London.
NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N).
Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district.
Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources.
For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg

job_description:
How Will You Make an Impact?
When you’re part of Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do challenging work, and be part of a team that values performance, quality and innovation. As part of a successful, growing global organization you will be encouraged to perform at your best. With revenues of more than $30 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.
You will be involved in the execution of molecular biology and protein biochemistry related testing for development of scientific instruments and assays. These tasks will primarily be based in the laboratory and as such, will develop applied skills in a diverse set of core and groundbreaking biotechnological methods. Furthermore, you will benefit from mentorship and exposure to fields such as molecular diagnostics. In addition, you will assist in lab management, handle the lab material and instrument status.
What will you do?
Operations duties
  • Collaborate and assist scientists in their experimentation.
  • Execute experiments following protocols independently and perform accurate record keeping.
  • Adhere to company policies and procedures following research and development scientific standards.
Sustaining duties
  • Assist with laboratory management duties, such as equipment maintenance, reagents inventory and purchasing, general housekeeping.
  • Participate in the development of new testing procedures/assays to support the release of new products.
  • Possess good knowledge of chemical preparation and waste disposal.
How will you get here?
Education
  • University student in Lifesciences or other related disciplines (Biomedical Science, Biotechnology or Pharmaceutical Science, Biologics & Process Technology, Pharmaceutical Science or Biomedical Engineering).
Experience
  • Working knowledge of real-time PCR will be an advantage.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills.
  • Work independently in a quick paced environment.
  • Proficient in Microsoft office.
  • Requires strong organizational skills and attention to details.
  • Must be self-motivated, results oriented, and work well in team setting with minimal supervision.
  • Proficient to read and interpret documents such as procedure manuals, operating and maintenance instructions.
Learning outcomes:
By end of internship, you will
  • Communicates clearly
  • Works well in teams
  • Shows initiative and independent learning
  • Understand laboratory operation and safety guidelines
  • Operation and maintenance of standard laboratory equipment
  • Develop critical thinking, report writing and analytical skills
  • Theoretical understanding of classical and real-time PCR
  • Understand PCR design strategies
  • Applied PCR techniques
  • Hands-on experience with Thermo Fisher instrumentation
  • Basic understanding of PCR analysis and associate data
  • Industry standard unidirectional workflow for molecular applications

company_overview:
DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.
DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.
DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.
With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.
job_description:
Business Function
  
Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the 'World's Best Digital Bank' (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Our approach is a combination of both science and art; we immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play. We are passionate and committed to making banking joyful (while having lots of fun)!  
Job Purpose

Deliver Data Science analysis to support business decisions for various Business Units of the Bank. Develop Advanced Analytics components to be included in innovative applications by creating prototypes and developing solutions based on advanced analytics, leveraging internal data sources as well as investigating the potential of external data sources.
Responsibilities
  • Train Predictive and Machine Learning models to solve various business questions.
  • Perform ad-hoc exploratory statistics and data mining tasks on diverse datasets from small scale to 'big data'
  • Select features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
  • Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
  • Extend company's data with third party sources of information when needed
  • Enhance data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
  • Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis
  • Carry out ad-hoc analysis and present results in a clear manner
  • Build Prototypes to demonstrate the derive actionable insights from data, as part of Agile teams
  • Work with Data Engineers to define data requirements and review recommended architecture
  • Program advanced analytics capabilities and algorithms to be included in new business solutions.
  • Develop visualization interfaces that help business make more insightful decisions
  • Maintain cutting edge in Data Science
  • Take initiative in evaluating new approaches from data science research
  • Test new tools and packages
  • Support the programs for changing the business culture towards more data driven
  • Identify, profile, analyze and present the data discovery output for analytic projects
  • Develop data ingestion pipeline and create the analytic data assets for analytic projects
  • Work with data engineer to enhance the analytic data infrastructure and develop enterprise analytic data mart
  • Perform data wrangling and feature engineering for machine learning
  • Create helper functions to automate frequently encountered wrangling and feature engineering tasks
  • Skills and Experience
Requirements
  • PhD/Masters/Bachelors in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, or related disciplines.
  • Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
  • Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
  • Highly proficient with data wrangling, analytic, transformation and feature engineering using programming tools such as Spark, Python or R. Excellent knowledge of SQL.
  • Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc .
  • Experience with data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, etc.
  • Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL, Hive, Pig
  • Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase
  • Good scripting and programming skills (Python, Java, Spark...)
  • Experience with commercial Analytics packages is a plus (Teradata, SAS, Qlikview...)
  • Practical experience in following domains, in addition to Machine Learning, is a plus: Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning, Time Series, Web/Log Analysis, Streaming Data Analysis, Geospatial Analysis
  • Great communication skills
  • Data-oriented personality
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Taste for working in teams, self-starter, able to work on multiple projects in parallel
  • Experience
  • At least 3 years of industry experience in data analytics working in a big data environment
  • Experience working in multi-cultural environments 
Apply Now​
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements
