job_description:
Senior/Scientist, Cognitive and Behavioural Modeling, Integrative Social Sciences Horizontal Technology Programme
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is setting up a new research initiative in the form of an Integrative Social Sciences Horizontal Technology Programme. The Programme, to be hosted in the Institute of High Performance Computing (IHPC), will focus on integrating social scientific principles with other disciplines to produce impactful, translational research.
Candidates should have a background in the cognitive or social sciences, ideally with strong quantitative skills (e.g. for modeling, measurement design/validation, or analysis of high-volume behavioral datasets).
We have particular interest in applicants with expertise in one or more of the following areas: 
  • Mental health and well-being, esp. with focus on sub-clinical and/or healthy populations
  • Decision-making, habitual behaviour, dynamics of behaviour change
  • Measuring and modeling urban behaviour, esp. related to transit and/or sustainability
  • Dementia and aging, including screening, support for healthy aging and caregiving
  • Cognitive neuroscience and neuroimaging, related to any of the above domains
  • Multi-modal techniques for cognitive assessment or diagnosis
The Programme is seeking candidates to participate in team-based research with a strong translational focus. Selected candidates will have the opportunity to participate in a variety of ongoing projects, and to propose and initiate new projects. Many of IHPC’s projects are conducted in collaboration with other research entities, public sector agencies and/or private companies. In keeping with the integrative mission of the Programme, candidates selected for this position will be strongly encouraged to pursue interdisciplinary collaboration with scientists from other Research Institutes across A*STAR, and/or to develop capabilities which can contribute to such collaborative projects.
The Programme’s key research domains include:
  • Health and wellbeing: Examining the social and psychological determinants of health and well-being, such as health disparities, effects of modern societies and technology on health attitudes and behaviours, or application of technology for health communication/intervention.
  • Social sensing: Measuring psychological or behavioural variables such as attitudes, personality or identity, and/or examining their implications for socially-relevant outcomes such as trust, cohesion, and misinformation susceptibility.  
  • Education: Using social and behavioural science or technological innovations to improve learning, motivation, cognitive flexibility, or social-emotional competencies, whether in the context of adult skill training or classroom-based teaching. 
  • Urban sustainability and solutions: Integrating cognitive and behavioural effects to better model urban decision making and dynamics and ultimately improve urban environments and enhance residents' quality of life (e.g., enable seniors to better age in place). 
  • Major duties and responsibilities:
  • Initiating and conducting innovative research that applies principles and methods of social science to address strategic societal challenges
  • Preparing grant proposals and reports
  • Supporting social science research initiatives across A*STAR by providing relevant domain knowledge and reviewing research proposals
  • Participating in outreach and engagement activities to foster collaborations with industry, government, and academic partners
  • Supporting ongoing social science research activities within the Programme and IHPC
  • Suitable candidates should meet the following core criteria:
  • A PhD from a reputable university in a cognitive or social science discipline relevant to the above. Degrees in quantitatively-oriented disciplines such as AI, statistics or computational modeling will also be considered if the candidate has a demonstrated record of applied work in one or more of the above-specified topic areas.
  • A compelling scientific track record and experience, commensurate with career stage.
  • The ability to contribute to one or more of the four research domains listed above.
The following characteristics would be highly desirable in a candidate:
  • Willingness to undertake hands-on development work in rapid prototyping of solutions and development of proof-of-concept systems.
  • Experience working across disciplines (especially collaborations between social and computational sciences) and / or developing solutions to applied societal problems.
  • Candidates should demonstrate ability, experience, and success in initiating, leading, and completing competitively funded research programmes.
  • Entry level candidates should have demonstrable research skills and a record of participation in research-related activity.
A*STAR is a catalyst, enabler and convenor of significant research initiatives among the research community in Singapore and beyond. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors, and bring science and technology to benefit the economy and society.
Please indicate the role you are applying for, in your application and on all correspondences.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
job_requirement_qualification: Doctorate (PhD)

job_title: Assistant Head/ Senior Officer (Intelligence Exchange), Enterprise
company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.
job_description:
﻿
To gear A*STAR up for the innovation-driven economy set out by the Research Innovation & Enterprise 2025 Masterplan, a new Enterprise Division (“Enterprise”) is being established in late-2020. Enterprise will further strengthen A*STAR in generating economic and societal impact for Singapore. Importantly, Enterprise Division will lend coherence to A*STAR’s RCA, licensing, and spin-off efforts. It will drive A*STAR’s companies strategy and companies portfolio management. Enterprise will also play a national role in terms of grants administration, over-watching national platforms like DxD Hub, and the Aerospace Programme, among others. It will be the focal point to drive I&E within A*STAR, as well as actively support I&E efforts in the wider ecosystem.As part of the Enterprise Intelligence Exchange team, you will:1.Generate market intel with a data-driven approach in emerging industry sectors/application areas
  • Market intel could include potential market size, market trends/drivers, value chain analysis, industry receptacles, and competitive landscape in the market of interest.
  • Where required by specific projects, to gather/develop insights into firm-level competitive analysis, as well as constraints on freedom to operate (FTO) in the geographical markets of interest.
  • The intel gathering/development approach involves:
    • Amalgamating market intel from external & internal stakeholders (e.g. EDB, ESG, A*STAR industry clusters);
    • Complementing this with market intel gathered from primary and secondary sources, such as trade shows / industry conferences, market research firms, key opinion leaders;
    • Working with IPM, IPOS, and other professionals for patent and FTO analysis.
2.Monitor/curate market intel in 3 key industry sectors:
  • Connectivity
  • Advanced Manufacturing & Precision Engineering
  • Trade & Logistics
3.Manage market intel toolkit for Enterprise/A*STAR
  • Develop/maintain best practices for market intel research;
  • Manage market research subscriptions & aggregate demand for Enterprise; and
  • Establish/maintain a repository of market intel sources and a network of key opinion leaders
Requirements
  • Degree in Physical Sciences/Engineering or relevant fields; an MBA, or Masters/PhD is useful but not necessary
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collate, analysis and dissect disparate sources of data
  • A strong interest in emerging technologies and startups
  • Ability to transverse and be conversant in various industry verticals
  • Effective and thoughtful communicator and presentor
  • Excellent time management and ability to multi-task and prioritise work while being meticulous and organised
  • A self-starter, independent and resourceful.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
job_requirement_qualification: Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree

company_overview: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.
job_description:
How Will You Make an Impact?
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $30 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them.
Our global team of more than 80,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.
What will you do?
  • Provides technical support to operations for Genetic Sciences. Plans, initiates and executes scientific development strategies within the operations group. Liaise with research and development on strategies for new product/test method introduction. Through research, proves and applies scientific theories to develop new and/or improved products, processes or technologies. Provides technical insight and knowledge to facilitate and lead changes. Performs complex problem solving on platforms in Genetic Sciences.
Responsibilities and Authorities
  • Responsible for new QC/IPQC test method transfer, validation to support new product release.
  • Participate in the development of the QC test methodologies & the QC metrics used for PASS/FAIL release criteria of microarray products.
  • Implement a process to continually evaluate and fine tune existing test methods to improve test robustness and throughput time.
  • Perform data mining to generate QC yield trends for monitoring the health of the array products and escalate for any deviation from top-line performance.
  • Design QC metrics which correlate array performance to potential quality excursions from raw materials, testing reagents, test equipment and environment.
  • Lead QC in cross functional teams to work on complex problems where analysis of data requires an in-depth domain knowledge and evaluation of various factors.
  • Conduct root cause analysis of poor array performance & DOEs with statistical approach in data analysis and good knowledge of sampling size to meet test release criteria without ambiguity.
  • Initiate change controls for QC testing which impact the form, fit and function of arrays.
  • Provide guidance in the analysis of quality related problems.
  • Ensure detailed records and product performance data are maintained to identify trends for preventive actions.
How will you get here?
Education
Minimum Degree in Biochemistry or related discipline; higher qualifications will be advantageous.
 
Experience
  • Minimum of 5 years of industrial experience preferably in pharmaceutical / biotech industries.
  • Experience in new assay development and QC laboratory testing.
  • Working knowledge of cGMP and QSR preferred.
  • Demonstrated ability in managing multiple tasks within tight deadlines.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
  • Proficiency in handling analytical instruments like HPLC, Spectrometers, Scanners.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills demonstrated ability to work independently in a quick faced environment.
  • Possess strong organizational skills, analytical, systematic and attention to detail.
  • Understand statistical analysis and design of experiment.
At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 80,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Apply today http://jobs.thermofisher.com
Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree, Doctorate (PhD)

ST Engineering Unmanned & Integrated Systems Pte Ltd is a subsidiary of ST Engineering
More than ever before, our customers are using digital technologies to accelerate digitalisation, innovation and business transformation.
Discover how we integrate digital technologies into solutions that strengthen the cyber resilience of your organisation, enabling you to harness the power of data analytics and machine learning to derive valuable and actionable insights, and drive your organisation with end-to-end cloud and data services.

  • To lead in the design, development and delivery of a new software system
  • To design and develop the data analysis module that may require statistical method, Artificial Intelligence techniques and Data analytics methods.

  • Initiating and conducting innovative research that applies principles and methods of social science to address strategic societal challenges
  • Preparing grant proposals and reports
  • Supporting social science research initiatives across A*STAR by providing relevant domain knowledge and reviewing research proposals
  • Participating in outreach and engagement activities to foster collaborations with industry, government, and academic partners
  • Supporting ongoing social science research activities within the Programme and IHPC
  • Suitable candidates should meet the following core criteria:
  • A PhD from a reputable university in a cognitive or social science discipline relevant to the above. Degrees in quantitatively-oriented disciplines such as AI, statistics or computational modeling will also be considered if the candidate has a demonstrated record of applied work in one or more of the above-specified topic areas.
  • A compelling scientific track record and experience, commensurate with career stage.
  • The ability to contribute to one or more of the four research domains listed above.
The following characteristics would be highly desirable in a candidate:
  • Willingness to undertake hands-on development work in rapid prototyping of solutions and development of proof-of-concept systems.
  • Experience working across disciplines (especially collaborations between social and computational sciences) and / or developing solutions to applied societal problems.
  • Candidates should demonstrate ability, experience, and success in initiating, leading, and completing competitively funded research programmes.
  • Entry level candidates should have demonstrable research skills and a record of participation in research-related activity.
A*STAR is a catalyst, enabler and convenor of significant research initiatives among the research community in Singapore and beyond. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors, and bring science and technology to benefit the economy and society.
Please indicate the role you are applying for, in your application and on all correspondences.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
job_requirement_qualification: Doctorate (PhD)

company_overview:
At the Cutting Edge of Medical Education
Duke-NUS Medical School (“Duke-NUS”) is Singapore's first and only US-style graduate medical school. Established as a landmark collaboration between Duke University and the National University of Singapore (NUS), Duke-NUS offers a holistic medical education against the backdrop of an extensive medical research that is integrated with the largest public healthcare cluster, the Singapore Health Services (“SingHealth”). This is an opportunity to perform a significant role in Singapore’s healthcare infrastructure and biomedical landscape.
job_description:
The Duke-NUS ABSL3 facility is a state-of-the-art high containment laboratory that allows researchers to conduct experiments including laboratory animal studies on BSL3 pathogens in a safe manner. The lab accommodates virologists, bacteriologist and immunologists alike for their various projects involving pathogens that require handling at a BSL3 facility. We have strong links with the Programme in Emerging Infectious Diseases and welcome researchers from other departments and universities as well.
This is for a full-time position who works as a Scientific Manr of the ABSL3 facility. The candidate’s main duties and responsibilities include:
  • Man research activities in the ABSL3 facility.
  • Train and supervise novel researchers in the ABSL3 facility based on existing Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
  • Develop new SOPs based on the regulation. 
  • Communicate with various parties involved in the operation of the ABSL3.
  • Perform safety checks in the ABSL3 with regards to experimental procedures and equipment.
  • Support ABSL3 facility staff in procurement, finance and administrative matters.
  • Evaluate and interpret collected data and prepare oral presentations or written reports/ scientific manuscripts/literature for publication.
Job Requirements
  • PhD, Master’s or Bachelor’s in Microbiology or related disciplines.
  • Prior work experience in a BSL3 setting.
  • Have interest in research on emerging pathogens.
  • Possess strong analytical and organisational skills with good writing, communication, and presentation skills.
  • Meticulous in adhering to and enforcing regulations.
  • A team player who is able to prioritise, multi-task and work collaboratively in a diverse working environment.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
job_requirement_qualification: Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree, Doctorate (PhD)

job_title: VP, Engineering & Architecture, Group Consumer Banking
company_overview:
DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.
DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.
DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.
With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.
job_description:
VP, Engineering & Architecture, Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology & Operations - (WD33346)
Business FunctionGroup Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.Your Responsibilities
  • Able to work closely with the applications teams and other architects to drive high quality application development, raising the bar of engineering practises and value adding to the technical delivery

  • Directing the architecture and development teams using a hands on approach

  • Establishing and owning engineering practise by improving current practises and coming up new practises were ever required

  • Create strategy, guidelines to improve software development, delivery with world-class quality outcomes

  • Define and own software standards, patterns, methodologies and practices including software quality, execution of agile software delivery

  • Able to project manage and allocated development capacity to completing scheduled task

  • Ensure agreed architecture is implemented by development team using agreed on patterns with engineering teams and architects

  • Perform POC's and come up with patterns and frameworks

  • Be part of team of architects and domain experts to provide fit for purpose solutions.

  • Transform requirements into architecture and blueprint for the solution being created. Conversion that is based on several factors: previous, successful design patterns, reference architectures and enterprise architecture guidance.

  • Understands business functions, construct a solution architecture around Microservices and APIs, and be able to decompose monolith applications into meaningful implementable Microservices and APIs in a Cloud/DevOps environment.

  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to the development team, during the SDLC. Get development team's buy-in into accepting the design to be implemented.

  • Ensure that the solution architecture aligns with the roadmaps established by the enterprise architecture, and that it adheres to the enterprise architecture principles. Act as the bridge between Enterprise / Application Architecture and Delivery.
Requirements
  • Experience and understanding of Engineering practises

  • Experience in design Cloud native, Event based and Microservice Architecture.

  • Deep End-to-End Enterprise Architecture understanding, including Enterprise Java Stack (JEE), Rich UI and Front-End technologies, Middleware technologies (Tibco, Solace etc), Mainframe technologies, Databases (SQL & No SQL), Data Warehouses, and Core Banking solutions.

  • Experienced in streaming technology or framework such as Kafka and able to select suitable technology for given situation, code quality Api/tool, logging/tracing, circuit breakers.

  • Experienced working in a cloud native work environment, spring cloud data, Spring Security, oAuth, service monitoring on cloud, PaaS environment such as Pivotal, Kubernetes.

  • Deep understanding of Enterprise Integration and Messaging Patterns, SOA Governance practices

  • Strong communication skills including engaging senior management on strategic plans, leading project steering committees and status updates etc

  • Experienced in Agile methodology.

  • Ability to work independently and handle multiple concurrent initiatives

  • Excellent organizational, vendor management, negotiation, and prioritization skills

  • Excellent team player and strong interpersonal skills

  • Proactive and able to work under pressure, strong problem-solving skills and positive 'can do' attitude
Apply NowWe offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

job_title: Scientist [Heterogeneous Catalysts], Material Science and Chemistry, IHPC
company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
company_overview:
The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.
As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.
job_description:
﻿
An Opening for a Research Scientist is available in the Material Science and Chemistry Department at the A*STAR Institute of High Performance Computing (IHPC).
Job Scope
  • 1)   Perform first-principles modelling of heterogeneous catalysts to understand reaction mechanisms and design improved catalysts for various reactions, especially in the areas of carbon-capture, utilization, and stor
  • 2)   Analyze data and publish findings in top scientific journals
Job Requirements
  • 1)   PhD in Chemistry/Chemical Engineering/Material Science or other related fields
  • 2)   Solid knowledge in surface science and heterogeneous catalysis
  • 3)   Experience with heterogeneous catalysis modeling using first-principles electronic structure calculations
  • 4)   Excellent analytical, technical, and problem-solving skills, and good scientific writing and presentation skills
  • 5)   Ability to work independently and in a team
  • 6)   Experience with Python programming is an added advant
  • 7)   Experience with Machine Learning is an added advant

Tencent is a world-leading internet and technology company that develops innovative products and services to improve the quality of life for people around the world.
